si9ZxbZb9AnI0UT_Aa_-vg.text: They really, really know what they're doing here! Our pizzas were fantastic. The crust was thin, but easily held up to the mountain of toppings without getting soggy...throughout the whole meal. My son and the grandkids constantly commented on how good it was, too. I apologize to my daughter for ruining them on cheap pizza, but even the non-crust eaters ate the crust. The toppings are super generous. You could barely see the pizza under the ham on my son's half. For a supreme pizza lover, this is the place. Go for the super,   Heck, one of the kids noted that the Coke tasted like McDonald's Coke. I can vouch for that statement. Some places have their mix a little too syrupy, but this was spot on. They have a nice espresso machine, so they may have a great water filtration system, too.   Garlic knots? Check! Bruschetta? Check!   The mango sorbet was very good, but the banana/dulce de leche gelato was unreal.

UFLKYK85st7U4bP1mKs70Q.text: We have now eaten here several times and have brought friends here.  While the restaurant is small (intimate), the food is wonderful.  It is cooked with care and with the best ingredients.  The sauces are wonderful and the cheese cake is delicious.  What we can not understand is how the owner can use the best ingredients and have such low prices.  Amazing!  Davo, the owner, greets everyone and chats with them.  He is truly a recontour. One of the best small Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.

kLVzjSwcLXpWqus7CR7Udw.text: Being from Chicago, you can guess that I'm going to be picky about pizza. I live by myself, so I like to order delivery once a month. I didn't want to review after my first pizza' it was delicious, but a mess. I ordered sausage and green pepper and the sauce was to die for. I also ordered chicken parm done perfectly! I thought this was gonna be my place! So I ordered again last night, just pizza and wings and, once again, the pizza was a mess. All the ingredients had slid to the side and cheese was resealed. You know the look. The crust is so good, the sauce perfect, but they can't get it to your house cut and toppings spread all over. I don't know what the problem is but when you receive your pizza like that, you can't get that perfect, cheesy first bite. And of course, the left overs are a mess, had to tear the pizza in where I thought the slice was. Disappointed, this would have been my new pizza home. UPDATED REVIEW: The owner, Jason, was concerned that I had received my pizza in poor condition. I reordered today, and my pizza was PERFECT! Delicious, meaty, perfect crust! Thank you for being so concerned about your customers, I really appreciate that. By the way, I also ordered the Chicken Parm, and there is something so addicting about that sauce, it's my favorite!

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and green pepper, absolutely perfect!

ES66yGjN_BZfZoMMyP4RKg.text: Being in Las Vegas for a week having a lot of different foods. I haven't had pizza. A good pizza place. Woke up on a later afternoon thier were no more dart competition me & my bf slept in. When we got dress my bf found this place heard a lot of great things most definitely the garlic knots. Reading the yelp reviews the garlic knots is a must try.  It's was a nice drive to get there. When we got there it my bf got a little discouraged about the place being small but we decided to go in anyways. It's a small place with 7 tables we were told to sit anywhere we like. Looked at the menu and seen a lot of pastas, sandwiches, & of course pizzas.  We were serve by a lady a nice lady asked what we wanted to drink and she mentioned about the garlic knots so we got a large order of the (12 knots). About 5 minutes later the knots came in they looked so damn good real garlic hella garlicky but good. So if you don't like a lot of garlic don't get it. Then I check in to this place & notice they had a $5 off coupon just by checking in. We had a speciality pizza we got the all meat pizza.  We were eating the knots then the pizza came in hot & fresh the cheese was zooey & cheesy it was New York style the crust was light and crispy. I had two slices I got full quick. My bf and his friend ordered zeppolis with chocolate drizzle. They LOVED it. They said it was soft & warm. I didn't want it because I don't like chocolate.  This place is wonderful. The food is great for pizza and desserts. I would definitely will go again when Im here in Las Vegas.

s1Opi6_86ArXfjJV0q7_gw.text: We had an excellent dining experience last night at Giovanni's Hole in the Wall. It was our first time there and we'll definitely return. Literally within 10 seconds of walking in the door we were greeted with a warm "welcome, come on in" from one of the owners. Our friendly waitress seated us immediately and poured us a generous glass of the house red wine as we received our menus. She made a couple of recommendations from the menu, gave us a few minutes, and came back to answer any of our questions. We ordered the calamari for an appetizer, and it was both plentiful and very tasty. The calamari has a light breading, most of it was the calamari rings, and it had a pleasant, sweet taste. They cooked it just right so there was a little firmness without being chewy. The menu says the lasagna is "the best in town". I decided to try it and see for myself. My wife ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. With our entrees we received two fresh house salads. The salads were made with romaine lettuce, broccoli, and cauliflower. The house dressing (vinaigrette) is made by the restaurant and is quite good. There are other dressing choices if vinaigrette is not your taste. A basket of six garlic knots came with our order as well. They were warm and smothered in butter. When our entrees came, my wife's eyes looked a little like deer in headlights because of the size of the meatballs (2) sitting on top of her spaghetti. They were close to being the size of a baseball, maybe a little bigger. The meatballs and spaghetti were yummy, the sauce was tasty with a little spiciness that didn't dominate the overall flavor. The lasagna was quite good as well. I'm not one who wants a lot of tomato-based sauce on my food (pasta or pizza). The serving did have quite a bit on top so I just slid it over. My wife said it would've been just the right amount for her. That said, next time I'd simply ask for light sauce or sauce on the side. The lasagna itself was a filling and scrumptious combination of meat, cheese, and pasta. We both had a sampling from each other's plate and gave it a thumbs up. During the dinner, the other owner came to our table to meet us, check on our food, and chat for a few minutes. He added to the welcoming environment. There was an abundance of food, so we brought a lot of it home. We did order a slice of the strawberry cheesecake to go. My wife described it as good and very creamy. The slice was on the small side. The atmosphere includes smaller tables, checkered vinyl tablecloths, a brick wall with lots of framed art, and candles in wine bottles with melted wax on the sides of the bottle. In the corner was a piano player playing enjoyable and non-intrusive lounge-style music. We were there late in the evening when there were about 15 other people in the restaurant. The room probably seats only about 40, so if it's full be prepared for a wait, and a little tighter feel as tables are close together. With our check came two complimentary creme de menthes, a nice little touch at the end. We liked the service, food and atmosphere, and we'll definitely be back.

O9PxyCPqAINRNqcNCMzsVQ.text: Meh. We ordered a small pizza, chicken fingers with fries and another side of fries ($36 with tip) for delivery through the Eat24 app on a Thursday night and it took more than an hour to deliver. The food wasn't worth the wait in any sense. First, everything was lukewarm, at best. The chicken fingers were soggy and a weird texture (yuck), the fries were dried out and cold and the ranch was watery and flavorless. The pizza (simple cheese) was the best part, but it was mediocre: not good or bad, but at least not dripping in oil or something. We won't be ordering again.

jCgy69mfFMA7ql42Gox_kw.text: I'm sad right now.  We drove across town to our favorite pizza restaurant.   We found new ownership and many changes.  The menu is the same, but far from the same food.  My usual salad with tomatoes, cheese and dressing was the same recipe, but instead of thick sliced tomatoes red ripe and juicy, it was thin sliced half ripe tomatoes.  Ugg.  The cheese garlic bread had cheese, thin as possible, on 2 of the 5 pieces.  The pizza was the worst disaster of all.  About 2 to 3 pieces of sausage each piece. 5OyCvfeaJe9NyXsfJRktCg.text: My first visit. The pizza was very good. Very cheesy, and the tomato sauce had a nice taste. The Italian sausage topping, though, was sparse. Some slices had only one small piece of sausage, and no slice had a lot. That was my only gripe, but even so, I enjoyed the pizza. The crust was not quite as good as Bambino's, which is a little crisper, but it was a good pizza. I also tried the meatballs, which were good, but garlicky.

n08aaFCd4gpPID3AbGAzwQ.text: Well this is awkward. I do not take a bad review lightly. So, I just called to order a pizza from here, as it has been a while, and was told that I was red flagged in their system to not have my order taken. For what you might ask? Well, let me begin by saying I am never rude nor do I not pay my bill. I am polite and always tip very well. That being said let us go ahead and explore my last experience with Papa Pinny's Pizzeria. I ordered a pizza, it arrived late and cold, I accepted the pizza in my hands and tipped the driver, and upon opening the pizza box in my kitchen it was very apparent the top of the pizza had shifted as if the delivery driver took a very, very, sharp turn...  Like a U turn... which led to the pizza topping shifting a good third worth over. So when I saw this, considering how much was spent on the pie (They are by no means a cheap pizzeria), I called and politely said that I was not satisfied with the quality of the pizza as it arrived. I mean.. Hell yes I want a pizza to arrive looking like a pizza with the toppings intact, who doesn't? The person who answered the phone said they would sent out a new pizza, when the new pizza arrived the delivery driver curtly requested I return the damaged pizza, which I did. I did not choose post anything at the time because I do not like to post negative reviews and understand that sometimes things just happen. We were satisfied with the new pizza and its condition. So, this bad review is because Papa Pinny's Pizzeria clearly does not take responsibility for a poor product that was clearly their error. Shame on them.

rnoa9vcZTKSCaKSe3kKxSg.text: Family friendly place with the BEST pizza around!!!! Been here three times and will come back as much as possible. I would recommend this place to anybody looking for great pizza! They also have great deals on Groupon right now

o2dqWW8WVQdcrzd8gNO0WQ.text: I miss the original Papa Pinny's. Apparently new owners took over and they are very disappointing. The marinara sauce is awful, the chicken piccata is a mess, the meatballs taste like garbage, the mozzarella sticks were burned, bottled soda was expired, and there's parsley dumped all over everything. They took a great neighborhood restaurant and turned it into crap.  Edit: I never worked at a restaurant. I live in the neighborhood where this restaurant is located and use to order from them regularly. Five months ago my husband and I received a terrible food order from them after the new owners took over. Maybe its changes are better now but I wouldn't know because I never got a response until 2 months after the fact. I'd love to try the restaurant again and give them another chance but the response below makes me doubt they care. I wish you the best.

E43jU5jYwzC4HFKDSf66lA.text: One word: GO! So, we've lived in Vegas about 10 months and have not been shy about venturing out to try new restaurants. Some not-so-bad but we probably won't visit again, some good but too pricey to make a habit and some, like this one, that move straight to the top of the list first visit! So, it's not just the food, which is, btw, utterly fantastic...but the total surprise of the quaint and comfy Italian ambiance secreted behind the heavy drapes in a crappy little strip mall with a flashing Pizza sign (really?) and the genuinely hospitable manner with which all the guests are treated. The owner pulls up a chair at your checkered-tablecloth table with a giant one-bottle wine glass in hand, fills your UP and lights your waxy Chianti bottle candle. The menu isn't overwhelming, just enticing, and we were hard-pressed to finally decide on "the best lasagna in Las Vegas" and chicken piccata--(both eye-rolling divine!!!) but not before being enticed by the organic beefsteak tomato, fresh mozzarella, basil and most amazing balsamic and olive oil dressing I have ever had--with garlic love-knots, no less!!! We were stuffed like fat raviolis but couldn't leave without Giovanni's labor of love, his creamy, dreamy not-too-sweet cheesecake! Thank you, you little hole-in-the-wall....what a delightful find you are!! Shhhhhh, don't tell anyone!

oA3nkDYj1Xvf0hb_8MjMiA.text: I was in Las Vegas for a week and I loved my first experience at this restaurant earlier in the week that I had to come back for my last meal in town. Everything I had: the calamari, the chicken and broccoli fettuccini Alfredo, and ESPECIALLY the cheese cake, hold the record of being the best I've had! My favorite restaurant of all time. When I'm back, I will be coming here. The servers and owner are so friendly and great. The decor is comforting and intimate. The music is excellent. I loved it! 10/10 recommend!

8evmAwM3GvqjGV5ZK4cX0w.text: My family of 5 just ate here tonight and we really loved this little hole in the wall restaurant! The ambiance is cozy and feels just like a hidden gem of a restaurant. It has the classic red and white checked tablecloths, huge waxy candles in the center, housemade wine. It reminded us of our recent trip to Italy!  The service was spot on, if a bit slow. But they were every attentive during the slow time, and sent out tasty salads on the house as we waited for our pizza and fettuccine. Our drinks were never empty, but continually refreshed. These people know how to make you feel at home! The food was great! The fettuccine was DECADENT! Creamy and full of beautiful flavor. The pizza has amazing crust flavor and chew, the toppings quality. The only downside us that the pizza is a little on the salty side. The housemade cheesecake is velvety with a forward sour cream note complemented by hints of vanilla and lemon. Really good! All in all, this hole in the wall is a great spot, and I'm so glad we ate here tonight. I'll be spreading the word!

I99Q2_xkLAMdd4RK1C39JA.text: Honestly the food and most of the employees are amazing. The cooks are awesome, the environment is perfect but there's a lady that works the register and serves that is the most annoying and rude person I've ever dealt with . She makes me want to leave as soon as I see that she's working. If you got rid of her you would be 5 stars all the way!!!

bgjr0cx7ZQV6q5-x9CBm-Q.text: Food is phenomenal  great meatballs great fettuccini  Alfredo love the garlic knots even the salad was super good  great atmosphere great service friendly people impressed  with all love love love the music also

63ewMZuuQKTrDyhDm29h3w.text: I went with my toddler and hubby. It was highly recommended by our extra picky friends so we were pretty excited to try it out. At first it looked like just a normal pizza joint from the outside but boy were we wrong. Our server was absolutely AMAZING. I had a steak and lobster and my husband a steak with alfredo pasta it was delicious! We also had the garlic knotts, cheesecake and bottle of wine everything was just perfect. We had such a great time and we will definitely come back and try that huge pizza they have.

r20CCAXHuDvNuqRGn2D76w.text: Stumbled upon this priceless, hidden gym, with my son Friday night. It felt like going back in time- old school Italian, with charm and ambiance that added to our experience. We were warmly greeted, and seated right away. House wine was poured, and fresh out of the oven garlic bread knots were served. The owner was very personable, and made us feel welcome, and the waiters were attentive and kind.  Our orders were taken (chicken parmigiana and linguine with white clam sauce) and a dinner salad was included. The guitarist and violinist played mostly throughout the meal which was great, as it added to the experience.  It didn't take long to get our meals, and it was as good as any Italian homemade meal I've made/had.  My son and I finished off the evening with splitting a slice of the incredible New York cheesecake with strawberries.  The price for our meals were beyond reasonable!  In the 19 years I've lived here, this experience was definitely at the top of time and money well spent.

4JHGo8jdOX40igSFe4DE7Q.text: This small, locally owned mom-and-pop-type shop has several tables to dine in. You'll be surrounded by lots of Chicago memorabilia hanging on the walls as you look through a menu that isn't limited to pizza. There's plenty of other Italian-American dishes ranging from pastas to calzones to sandwiches and chicken wings.  The pizza is pretty good compared to most quickie, take-out or delivery places but not on par with the top pizza makers in town. Their crust is thin, chewy, with only slight crispness. Their meat lover's pizza is generous with toppings with a tangy sauce with some acidity to it. Their white pizza was excessively oily (yeah, I know it's a white pie, but even by those standards it was too much).   They're a clear step up from pizza chains and prices are respectable. As close as they are to my house, I'm sure I'll give them another shot and try more of their menu.

DEMjb904ZqW4rv9by6c-Hw.text: This was a total accidental blessing of a find! I was dropping my friend off at the gym next-door and I had a craving for garlic knots so I stopped in to see if they had any. This place was so good and the pasta smell so good when I walked in the door that I took my friend back there to sit and dying in the next day.The owner was great, very friendly and offered us complementary wine. We had the fettuccine Alfredo which was bomb, and of course more of those amazing garlic knots. It is a little bit higher price then a cheap quick bite to go, but reasonable for the food and the portions. I highly recommend this if you like authentic Italian, it has a real New York feel which I do realize is not Italy, but I have not been to Italy so the best reference I can give use New York.

AFFjjRdhhtllMCLnMYw7rA.text: I went into this place tonight to have a slice of pizza with my husband and son.  Pizza  is their food of choice in any given situation, but we hadn't gone in to Papa Pinny's yet.  Boy, am I glad we did! It's our new favorite!!! I ordered a garden salad, expecting iceberg lettuce, half a tomato, and a bit of bitter dressing, like other pizza places.What I got was such a level up, I was amazed! 4 or 5 different greens, chick peas, kidney beans, tomato, cucumber, olive, etc...beautiful array, topped with mozzarella cheese, and wonderful, homemade dressing...plus, the amazingly charming owners treated us to some extra special garlic bread...the kind my Italian grandma used to make! We ate like no tomorrow!  When the pizza came out, it was cooked to flavorful perfection! The crust was a cut above. We will definitely go back, bring friends, and hope to score more of that incredible garlic bread! Loved it!!!!

0jO7pOMyWlfLhgR0cHNlFg.text: We drove out of our way from the Strip because of the Yelp ratings.   We got the Pinny Signature pizza. It was good, but not awesome or anything outstanding. The pizza knots were ok, but nothing memorable. The sauce for the pizza and the knots were too tomatoey for my liking and lacked typical Italian seasoning. Got the six-piece wings (hot) and they came with an order of fries. The wings and fries were both good and worthwhile.   Service was meh. The server either wasn't paying much attention or something else was amiss. Kept having to repeat and reclarify the order. There wasn't any language barrier, so I don't know...  While she was attentive, she gave off the aire of hovering over us -which was both annoying and creepy. She also stood behind the refrigeration/display counter staring in our direction when not hovering -no doubt she was watching the game on TV -but it was creepy.   I'm glad others have had good experiences here. But there are other choices for independent Mom&Pop pizzeria fare -and I think we will continue to shop around.

sZnMqL6CHEccyhOY830Zag.text: The garlic bread here is to die for. The salads are good. But the spaghetti wasn't that good....to me. The atmosphere was nice, staff were helpful, and the bathroom was clean.

s7rYWwjJ-BI22-LmLXi3Gg.text: OMG!!! Where do I start?! First off, my order consisted of a 12" Pinny's Signature Supreme Pizza, with extra pepperoni, extra mushrooms, extra cheese and extra sauce, and 12 pieces Jumbo Wings Medium sauce with blue cheese. It came to $42.45. Worth every heavenly morsel! My delivery time was 30 to 45 minutes it arrived at 37 minutes into the delivery time, mind you, I live on West Charleston and Torrey Pines. Kudos to the driver, he was very friendly and made my mouth wish I had ordered the garlic knots, they sound Delish! So on to the food, the smell of the pizza and wings, drew me in like those old cartoons where they levitate to the food, I kid you not! The pizza was piled high with toppings and extra pepperoni, mushrooms, cheese and sauce as I had asked! Woohoo!! It gets better, I went to lift a piece of pizza out of the box and it was a little soggy, now, I know it was contributed to all the extras so I wasn't too shocked. Now the great part! The pizza, despite a little soggyness(my fault) was beyond, it had the green and black olives, crispy pepperoni, fresh tomatoes, mushrooms( no can here) and crispy big (not too big) bacon. The onions and green peppers were fresh and crisp not soggy Now the sauce is homemade in the best way! Great seasoning! The crust was crisp on the edges and tender and flavorful. Homemade dough is the secret! Man, do they have it right, all of it! Now the catcher, I called to give my praise and Rosy answered I asked to speak to the manager, Rosy politely related that they do not have a manager, yet a owner and he was with a customer, " Could she take a message". I went in and praised my order from wait time, to the sauce, to delivery driver John. Best online order experience I have ever had! No question about it! Now just a little back story, I throw down in the kitchen in all styles of food, so I know my way around the kitchen. I bake,cook,grill and make all my own breads and dough. I make pizza as well, and let me to tell you, this pizza and wings made me do the happy dance and want more! I just moved today, and afterwards, did not want to cook, after being in the hot, muggy, humid air. I was skeptical, reading the reviews, I decided to give Papa Pinny's Pizzeria my coin and I am elated I did! I have lived here since 1990, and it is really hard to find a great pizza place, pizza hut has been mine because I got tired of paying big bucks to only get disappointed. I can vouch , not the case here, I hope Pappa stays around for the rest of my years in this life and then some! Don't change a thing Pappa! Don't get overwhelmed with profit margin and cut corners, and whatever you do Pappa, DO NOT FIRE ROSY OR JOHN, HECK THE PIZZA MAKER EITHER!! I appericate you!

O938_40a6oKBBbixCrpSpw.text: This place is a couple doors down from where my daughter takes piano lessons. Small hole in the wall with only 6 or so tables, and it seems like they recently remodeled and added outdoor tables and wine decor inside.   This isn't the first time we have been here. Treated my daughter (5 years old) to a candle lit dinner last night and it was great so it reminded me to review. I didn't review in the past, because I loved the pizza but the spinach salad was sooooo greasy, and I wanted to only give a 4 or a 5 cuz I know they're trying. Waited it out and they've since removed that salad from the menu, ha!   I was at the mercy of the kindergartener, so we ended up with a cheese pizza and Caesar salad. I really liked the Caesar. Perfectly dressed...not crazy amounts of dressing.   Pizza is surprisingly good here. The crust is crisp on the bottom and sides, and chewy. I recently saw this Yelp type influencers posting videos of some pizza place that uses scissors and the guy citing talks about the "crack crack"...it's just like that. I like the semi tart sauce. Cheese is a little greasy since it's normal shredded mozzarella (as opposed to the buffalo mozzarella like Grimaldi's, or whatever they use there), but a very satisfying pizza.   They brought us this super tasty garlic bread (basically a super buttered, super toasted soft hoagie), complimentary.   Sit down service can be slow because there are only a few tables, and the server (who we've had every time) has to answer phones, be a hostess, put together Grub Hub orders, etc. She is a super sweet lady and I tip her 50% every time. I know she is trying her best and I appreciate her.   I'm sad that we will be quitting piano at this location and it's pretty far for us to drive, but we will be back.

f6WavivELTa3-mYvbMVRxw.text: Before the change in name and (I assume) ownership, this was our go-to place for delivery pizza.  Not anymore.  The quality has gone down, and the prices have gone up.  The menu is also pretty sparse.  I think (although I'm not positive) that a lot of offerings have been pulled off the menu.  Giovanni's has also outsourced their deliveries to Grub Hub.  That meant I could double-check my on-line order after it arrived.  Sure enough, I had ordered what I thought I had ordered, but that's not what got delivered.  One of our two pizzas was the wrong size.  Our side pasta bore no resemblance at all to the description on the menu, and was nearly inedible.  (Here's a tip, Giovanni's - fettuccine is not a small tubular pasta, and lobster is not the same thing as calamari.)  This is the second place in Vegas (that I know of) that bills itself as a "hole in the wall."  In both cases that description is pretty accurate, and not in a good way.  We thought we had found a great place for delivery pizza, and now we are back to searching.  Oh well...

K-NtB7-kxhIXiLczEXRhgA.text: Not True. Would not abide by what is listed on web site. He did credit back my account on the charge card. Very rude!

8GGs8T3wEYBg-MOFQqwJcQ.text: This place is awesome.   Great food at a reasonable price. My daughter and I had spaghetti which was amazing. Wife had filet and lobster tail for $19.99.   Oh... and the Cheesecake... best I've ever had. Like wow good.

3aYyEvWM7_vMilCQmHOjrA.text: OMG! This place is hands down 1 of..if not THE BEST Pizza/Italian food I've ever had! 1st, let's start of with the ambiance, it's so adorable. It's small & intimate but its perfect. I felt like I was at a legit Italian restaurant in Italy. The music, the decor, the setting was just amazing. The service was 100000% on point. The moment we set foot in the place, we were greeted & seated. The whole staff was so nice & helpful. They made us feel so welcome. We sat down & instantly got attended, our server I believe was the owner himself & his attention to detail catering to us was phenomenal. He went over the specials, what was popular & what he recommended & it was just nice. He served us a cup of this amazing wine that he assured went well with everything on the menu. & lemme tell you, he was right. The wine he gave us paired well with EVERYTHING we ordered. It was complimemtaey btw, for us being 1st time customers. He also hooked us up with some Garlic Knotts, a House Salad & the wine...on the house! Everything was made fresh! Most definitely worth the wait! Ugh I cant get enough of this place. I fell in love with it & the food! We ordered a meat lovers pizza, a calzone, chicken alfredo & the Caprese Salad. I cannot lie when I say all of it was exquisite!  IT was just beyond delicious, words just simply cannot describe how good this food was. You have to try it for yourself 2 understand. I HIGHLY recommend this place. I will most definitely be coming back. The ingredients taste so fresh & it all tasted so good. The alfredo was my favorite, the sauce was 2 die for! You can just taste the quality of the ingredients. So rich & creamy. Perfection! I also ordered the cheesecake but I have yet 2 try it because I'm so full, but ugh. More people need to know & come to this divine establishment. I can go on for DAYS reviewing how amazing the food was & the exceptional customer service of this restaurant but I will let yall experience it for yourselves! Please, next time you are in the mood for authentic, delicious, exquisite food. Come 2 Giovanni's. You will not regret it. A hole in the wall it is indeed. Amazing, simply amazing beyond all rationality. I simply cannot put into words how happy I am with this place.

HW4BFDIRt2Mn59KEN91mfQ.text: First: Ordered a pizza for delivery. A bit pricey at $25+ for a supreme, but the pizza was huge and loaded up with toppings. Crust was good, sauce had flavor, and there was plenty of cheese. Order arrived on time, if not a bit early. It's rare for me to do delivery, but this is a place I'd keep in mind for the future. Four stars!  Second: Came in to pick up an order of pasta. Location is cozy, staff was polite, order was again ready quickly. The chicken piccata has protein, pasta, a bread stick and a side salad, all nicely priced for $14. Unfortunately, the sauce makes this dish and it was lackluster. Something was missing, it was just okay. The side salad was ordered with bleu cheese dressing which seemed to be either a cheap bottled brand or made in-house by someone who doesn't know it. It was gross and ruined the salad. Two stars?  Third: Ordered takeout again, got the antipasto salad with the bruschetta app. Ton of food, around $15. The bruschetta was fine but the salad was a bust. Looked more like a plate of cold cuts with meats and cheeses on a scant handful of spring mix. "House italian" dressing was a creamy version that was gross and brown? The whole thing looked and tasted like it was made by someone who doesn't like salads for other people who don't like salads. But the bruschetta was good. Three stars it is.  TLDR: Stick to the pizza and maybe the appetizers. Order pickup or delivery through the app, they're quick and friendly.

W4un2TUBsLEElvPWswV-0g.text: So I wanted to be lazy and order in so I chose this place using the GrubHub application via Yelp.  I put in all the info and it said estimated arrival 9:34 pm and by 9:40 pm I am calling Giovanni's asking where my pizza is.  A nice lady Annie answers and puts me on hold and come to find out GrubHub never faxed them!  So why did I give this place a 5?  Its not the restaurant's fault but they took full responsibility which was impressive.  Pizza and bruschetta was great just like their customer service.  Annie was so nice, had the food delivered in 15 minutes, threw in a 10 dollar voucher and apologized for something that wasn't her fault (shame on GrubHub). Now let's talk food. The bruschetta was fresh and flavorful and is a must at this place.  I chose the Mexican pizza because the only other place I've experienced that had such an option was the chain Godfathers pizza (so good).  If a taco and a pizza had a baby this would be their love child.  Ground beef,  chorizo, jalapenos, sour cream, tomatoes, olives . . . food fusion at its best.  Only thing it was missing was a lil shredded lettuce on top and maybe a few beans in the mix. Otherwise still amazing .  Conclusion: throw some hot sauce on this pizza and have a fiesta in your mouth.

TSdm_OD4TX0rJR4QdVdH6A.text: After searching on Yelp and wanting to eat pizza, we saw that this place had almost 5 stars. I didn't believe it until we ate the food. it was awesome! gnw8hRg6Dm1j7bFmHTFM9w.text: We were looking for a new pizza place in town, and we found a winner! Def will be back very soon. XKqwgF5cnJyaEPT95MSl4w.text: We've been in Las Vegas over 25 years and have longed for the great tasting pizzas from our Midwest upbringing.  We have tried almost every pizza place in town and we have finally found a pizza that blows every other place in town away.  We found  it on Yelp, and decided lets go......what a stroke of luck and genius.  Walked in smelled amazing, the owner Jason greeted us right away and recommended a pizza.  WOW, YUMMY, the crust is crisp and delicious and the toppings (Pepperoni & Sausage and Veggies) were to die for..(think he brings in his ingredients from Chicago, where he's from)  The prices are reasonable, beer was cold and the place is spotless.  We were planning our return trip on the way home.  Way to go Jason!!!!!  John & Jayne (Packer fans, sorry)

RsJg6EurJ7XEMj0P1UUKuw.text: Came to Las Vegas for a soccer tournament and a parent found this place.  Fantastic food and even better service!  If I were local, this would be a regular stop for me and my family.

kDUU18pLD4zbEje8sVuzDQ.text: Not from this area and found them on Yelp.  The service was fantastic.  There were 20 of us that came in from a soccer tournament.  The owner and staff could not be more accommodating.  All the food was delicious.  The pizza was hands down the best I have tasted in a long time!  Definitely recommend this place!

YSh3z_NLvKPV3a-LDEoUBQ.text: Incredible!!! Came in cold off the street and let me tell you, I went on the limb and just asked for their recommendations off the the menu needles to say it was unbelievably delicious. 5K6zKHo2QaaeGhv6BTUsvQ.text: Wow! the first time I ordered from them delivery,  They called me and asked if I can pick up from them and they would waive the delivery fee because it would take them over 2hrs to deliver. I live 3 miles away. But I agreed to still pick it up. 1 month later I order for delivery again. And these fuckers never show up. I call to follow up 1hr 30min later. And theyre closed. Wtf!!!!!!!! Get these incompetent fuckers out of here. Me and my family were starving dude. Waited for nothing....

uuCWJrK6860jP2xxLfcSYQ.text: Greeted by a nice lady when my bf and I walked in. I didn't catch her name though. The place isn't very big, limited tables. There are a couple of TVs in there & filled with football stuff! definitely a place to hang out at for game nights.   So we ordered a couple of things starting with the garlic knots. Myyyyyy goodness. These were amazing! By far the best I've had in Vegas. Came out hot & fresh & just amazing. Probably my favorite out of everything that we ordered. We got a large margarita pizza & with the check-in, it's $5 off! I'm not sure if I even liked margarita pizzas before today??? Lol but this pizza was soooo good! Hot, fresh, crispy crust, good flavoring. Idk what else you can really ask for. We also ordered zeppolis ,or however you spell it, to go. These were okay. I'm not sure if it was cos we took it to go? They weren't bad though.   The nice lady always made sure to ask if we were okay, or if we needed anything, and made sure our waters were never empty. Really good customer service!   Overall, definitely one of the best pizzerias in the valley. Will keep coming back! Even if it's quite a drive lol.

neXy5xXtHp61Q2nBHpeo7w.text: To support local biz, We've been going here at least every other week. It's close to home, and the pizza is satisfactory. However this last time, they got my pizza order wrong, and then did not double cut as we always get, and then argued about the situation after the fact. Not that hard guys.   I didn't blame the order taker or the pizza cook. But a guy came from the back and was totally disrespectful, full of profanity. I called for the owner who came from the back.  He was rather apologetic, but the guy from the back continued with the profanities. I could  not believe it. Giovanni , the owner, stood there and listened to him shout profanities and did nothing.  He disappeared after 2min.   Mistakes happen. I have no problems with mistaken orders. But I cannot believe the absolute poor service, profanities, and the owner cowering to an employee, despite clear mistakes. No, i will never be back. Giovanni is the new owner. He's in for a rough year.  There are at least a half dozen pizza places within a mile from here. It's not about one pizza order, right or wong. if I'm right, they will be out of business in 18months.

rStC3UcmZuEebEh4_XaBTA.text: Pizza somehow arrived cold, burnt, and not cut all the way through. The Uber Eats driver was nice though. I personally would only eat in at this place so I could make them remake the food.

rBxBRTJcAqSM__mC7ak9Gw.text: I ordered for delivery, I liked what they had to offer on the menu. The person that answered was polite and courteous and my order came quickly and was delivered within good time.   The pizza? Not a fan. I ordered their version of a margarita (sp?) and one half pepperoni half cheese.   As soon as I took a slice of the first, the tomato and one basil leaf with a slice of unmelted mozzarella slid off entirely. The pizza is covered in sauce and they place a regular slice of tomato, one leaf of basil, and a slice of fresh mozzarella. The mozzarella is poor quality. It didn't melt and the consistency and flavor were totally off. It tasted like rubber. I wanted to give it another chance, but the second slice was completely soggy. Wet pizza crust from the tomato and too much sauce. Would not recommend ordering.   The second pizza I took a slice of and because the ratio of cheese to crust was out of balance, the toppings came completely off.   Way too much cheese for a super thin crust. The texture of the crust was ok, but the crust doesn't have enough salt in the dough. The sauce is ok. A bit tart, but decent if not completely drowned by cheese.   The timing and service were really good.  The pizza. Some of the worst I have had in a long time. Won't order again.

-CdXeCaHznpuBzB7q1dAdA.text: Came down to visit Vegas and found this restaurant and let me say it was an amazing experience. I haven't had real authentic Italian food in awhile and this definitely hit the spot. The chef did such an awesome job and pays close attention to every detail about the food he is sending out. The owners and waiters made sure my wife and I were well taken care of. I had the eggplant Parmesan and I wasn't disappointed at all. I can safely say it was the best eggplant Parmesan I have ever had. We also shared a salad and pizza which were also very good. I will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas!

3X1C1EH8oVqzAZ0ZgFUR1g.text: You'll feel like you stepped into Italy, and your tastebuds will thank you! Great ambiance, excellent service, ample servings, and DELICIOUS!!!! Will definitely come back (a LOT)!

IupC3CRT1Rkb1TeHs07qDw.text: $18 for a huge slice of pizza, dozen giant wings, and excellently seasoned steak fries. Pizza is thick and the crust is crispy. The wings are naked and the hot sauce is pretty tasty. Staff is great. Get here.

zFAW3CK3DDDNc9OVtZwQSg.text: This pizza place has become a wonderful hole in the wall.  The atmosphere is wonderful.  The place is small.  Just a few tables.  But the service is 5 plus. The caprice was amazing.  Very fresh.   The house salad was also delicious.  I enjoyed the spaghetti which had fresh parsley.  Meat balls were A+.  Very good.   The lobster ravioli was excellent.  I also tried the clam sauce which was very good too.  One of the best in town I was told.  Someone also ordered the fettuccine and loved it.   So I highly recommend, but go with patience and to enjoy the atmosphere which is unique.

ZE19SjroJo37hOFjgSGb7w.text: There aren't enough great things I can say about the place. EVERYTHING was fantastic. From the apps straight through dessert, everything was a delight. NO JOKE I ATE THEM COLD later in the day. I can't think of ONE GOOD A$@ COLD FRY that I've ever enjoyed UNTIL NOW!! I got hungry all over again. 0b6bXy_oYcpj402amFUDJw.text: Edited review--the owner contacted me immediately upon reading my review and offered me a dinner for two this was incredibly caring to immediately attempt to rectify the situation, which I greatly appreciated. I wish Giovanni the best!  Review: Greatly disappointed in the customer service and my order tonight. We are visiting from Seattle and I wanted to go somewhere off the strip, I thought this place sounded perfect, big mistake! I ordered a to-go order via GrubHub and we picked it up, they weren't busy at all my husband had a nice conversation with the host who had been having a nice conversation with another guest at the bar eating his spaghetti. We drove 10mi back to where we were staying...we ordered one spaghetti meal which is spaghetti, salad, garlic bread, and in addition a mozzarella appetizer,  also on the receipt clearly written was "please add napkins and utensils." That's forgivable if they didn't have utensils, no problem. We left a $4 tip for the to go order online ($30) and left. However, when home we discovered there was no salad and no garlic bread, sigh.., so I call and ask for the manager just to let them know to quality control before the order leaves the door and the host or the individual answering the phone said "call back in five minutes (I did not let him know there was a problem with the order I just said I need to speak to the manager) the manager is in a meeting with one of the owners." So I called back and it goes to a fax, so I called back again and I was placed on hold and then eventually hung up on so I called back again and I said I'm waiting for the manager and he says, "oh that's right" and hangs up on me again (mind you I didn't mention wants to him that he hung up on me already) so I call back the fourth time and I get the fax again, finally I called back the fifth time and said I'm waiting for a manager and he said he was the manager, different voice, I told him I had gotten an order to go he said "I packed it up myself" I said  the garlic bread and the salad isn't in the order...long pause....tick-tock, and then he said "I usually keep the salads put away until you arrive for pick up to keep them cold and I'm staring at the bread right now." Oh great that doesn't make me feel any better you're staring at my hot garlic bread that I was craving! I proceeded to let him know I was just calling to give him feedback regarding quality control before to-go orders leave, and told him about phone issue, he said, "Well that's rude," re phone issue. I felt it was sarcastic, that he was just trying to sweeten up the situation, all in all he said he could offer us an in-store credit I declined and I said we won't be back because we are from Seattle, he then gave me somewhat of a genuine apology. All in all I would've had a greater experience had I went to Albertson's and got a jar Ragu and cooked it myself!!! He also gave  me the typical excuse of a manager, "oh he must've been busy" referring to the guy at the front, umm no he wasn't!   In this area the key to success is excellent customer service and accuracy! There are 1000 other pasta joints I could've went to!

qKlz5BR5LtJ8STdRIxp5nw.text: Amazing pizza and vibes. Got it to go and it was still great when I got home. Seemed small inside though so it would be close quarters if you were to dine inside.

LgtEWpcJGwcFWh9Rb0bDxA.text: Ordered take out pizza here. It was a large with mushrooms, onions and Italian sausage. I think I'd have to eat in to go all the way to a 5 star rating as the crust was a bit soggy and I found the sausage a bit salty. I think the crust would be great hot and fresh in the restsurant!  The flavors were wonderful. Nice tomato sauce, great cheese and I really liked the mushrooms. The onions were nice and sweet!

fdm6mBzfmucX-wjZJVnXFg.text: What an amazing place to eat.  I had steak and lobster and it was so delicious and huge portions.   The price was so reasonable. Very small and intimate dining with entertainment. It's a must to go to. Don't miss this little gem!!!  You will go back for more.

VJIT9tbgG2AipUTVCGii3Q.text: How I've missed this place until now is still a mystery. My bf and I went on an unexpected date night here and left beyond impressed. From my giant $6 glass of wine, to Gio himself I loved everything about this small Italian hidden gem.  The outside looks like a place to grab a slice, and it is, but it's so much more than pizza. You walk into a romantic dim lit setting with Italian music playing, and a friendly staff, including the boss man Gio, his huge glass of wine, and welcoming attitude won me over before I even tasted the mouthwatering lasagna. Which was truly just that, literally the best lasagna I've had since my Aunt Paula's. The guy went for the steak and lobster special and was happy with everything other than the lobster. Said he'd pass on it a second time but the steak was of a decent quality and the homemade mushroom sauce on top is the real treat. Including wine and dessert we spent $60 and I can't remember the last time we have done that at a nice Italian restaurant for date night. Even if you're not in the area, it's worth the drive at least once. I can't wait to return and try more of their offerings!

-sK7iCN1ice4jo7WRULKeA.text: Kind of underwhelming considering how good the reviews. It just was a boring kinda bland pizza. Nothing really special. But it's still pizza!

hq08SrpDhkC80gofPZgH9w.text: Excellent food   Excellent atmosphere.  Excellent service.  I can't wait to go again.  Definitely my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!!!!!

9ku8671ncIKmIeqsOW2V2Q.text: We tried to order delivery via EAT24, but we were out of the delivery area. I went on Papa Pinny's website and walla delivery!!!!  We ordered a large Supreme Pizza, a medium White  Pizza, Chicken Fingers and Fries, Pasta with Garlic and Olive Oil. Supreme pizza was very tasty, lots of great flavor, but the crust didn't support the amount of toppings. Wish they would have cooked a bit longer. The White Pizza would have been amazing except they use frozen chopped spinach, not fresh! I won't order that particular pizza again. The chicken fingers were great! Some of the best I have had, the French Fries were not crispy.... but it was delivered so I won't hold that against them.  The delivery part weighs in again with the pasta. The flavors are amazing! But wish the pasta was a bit more al dente. It's hard to have good pasta delivery!!! The side salad was great! That was a nice surprise for a pizza place!  This one was tough to review. Three stars because of delivery issues on the quality of the food, but I think if you eat in it would be much better!

M4NrrMwNO17wjtX1uMitqg.text: Pizza was okay. Careful they won't honor the yelp advertisement for 1/2 off second pizza. Kinda disappointed I wanted to really like this place! I may or may not give it another shot. Maybe it's better dining in than taking out.

w26lJRbN0IdJL1nAP7a3MQ.text: Great hole in the wall spot! Love the ambiance, the service and the food! The portions are just right, not too much at all that I will consider fattening (and I do eat quite a bit); prices are very fair.   Overheard a young couple (white male, Asian female) who recently moved to Las Vegas from California give their two cents to the waitress suggesting that the garlic bread should have been made all-you-can-eat, and that the portions should be bigger. I found it funny considering she was less than 5' and plump.   In any case, I recommend this place for a bite to eat and a place to chill out. Nothing fancy, just good food, with the right serving portions! Will definitely be back!

lx_Vguxw-3f0fSo0nPraTw.text: I came for the garlic knots, I stayed for the pizza.  After reading the reviews about the garlic knots I decided they sounded worth driving across town for. Y'all were right and for that, I thank you! Covered in buttery goodness and chunks of real garlic, I'm a fan. I honestly would just order those along next time with extra sauce. Pay for the extra sauce people and dunk your little hearts out.  The pizzas were simply okay. I had their signature supreme and although it was loaded with toppings, it lacked in the cheese and sauce. The crust was delicious. A little crunch and a whole lotta flavour. The white pizza was delicious in flavour but the crust was a miss for me. Perhaps I could order the white pizza with the supreme crust next time? I dunno! I'll have to ask.  I did drive across town and back for the order (we're talking 20 minutes and then some each way) so no points deducted for the food not being hot. When I picked up the boxes the food was piping hot and my car smelled of marinara and garlic for days. I was able to order pickup through the Yelp app, my order was accurate, and the staff was super nice.  I was surprised to see the intimate space set up like a little Italy. Different styles of tables and chairs for your to dine in. They even have a few tables set up outside. It would be a really cute little date night spot. It's True love if you both order your own garlic knots and don't mind kissing after.

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pinny s Signature Supreme Pizza. Good flavor but I would have loved more cheese. Noted for next time!
Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The White Pizza. Super good but next time I&#39;m going to add bacon.
Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Knots. 12-piece. A must. Order extra sauce and thank me later.

7SRB_5SJVKVdwjbziatTAg.text: Simply put: Delicious Italian food. Nice atmosphere too. Real Italian ladies in the back make it.

1t4cnL0SUmDOhVtouf9UjQ.text: This is such a cute little hole in the wall. The pizza and calamari were really good. Will definitely be back to try some pasta.

JTILBrNrYYPTeFc7t28w2A.text: Late in posting my review. My husband and I went here back in December. It really lives up to the name. If you don't know it's here, you won't see it. The place is very small, seats maybe 20-25 people, but the ambiance is fantastic! If you have children in strollers or you need a high chair, find a different restaurant. This is not a place for small kids. The food was great! My husband ordered a pizza and I had the spaghetti and meatball. Yes, you read that right, one large meatball. It's all you need.  We were stuffed after eating but we were convinced to try the cheesecake. The lightest cheesecake I've ever had in my life! He wouldn't reveal his secret, but it was so good! The wine that was paired with the food was fantastic! I think it was the house wine.  Highly recommend this place to everyone, locals and tourists alike!

YdWd34f-ISjMKnYxO5PaAw.text: Came here with a group for my birthday and we were treated SO well. The waiter was so funny and had us rolling on the floor laughing... well, maybe the giant wine glasses helped too. I had the chicken parm and it was the best! We also had unlimited bread, salad (included with entree), calamari, shrimp Alfredo, pizza, NY cheesecake and dessert spirit. We left stuffed and schwifty! The owner Davo is a great story teller, his conversation was entertainment on top of the violin player. It was the best location I could have had my birthday at! So romantic, fun and yummy! Thank Davo!

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Py-n-zpdiQCL1Zw1n8jgg.text: Chef James definitely took care of us. You can tell the love and effort was put into what he does for a living. He was very attentive and down to earth. Had some great recommendations on food and the choices we made. It definitely is a "hole in the wall" but don't let the outside or decor fool you. This place is worth every penny spent! Well done.

Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi Alfredo style for me. Filet mignon topped with some mushroom sauce, lobster tail, and fettuccine.

YLYclPK0REMw1FlBbAY6OA.text: another great experience - lots of laughs with Davo the owner.  Ok all the food this visit 5 start - I had steak and lobster - mushroom brandy sauce was very good.  wifey had lobster ravioli with shrimp Alfredo sauce - very good.  polished off bottle of house wine - Dego Red as we jokingly call it - typical Italian table Chianti - brought us salads, garlic knots, and fried polenta as tasters - super yummy - cheese cake rocked

KcLlL_0b69CDMRWQSwTFZg.text: too bad, based on the reviews i thought this restaurant would be my go to for Italian food.  my daughter and i had the chicken dishes which was mediocre at best.  picante n marsala was very disappointing.   They also wouldn't honor the 1/2 price on the second entrees.

4kFGSrtmoq_U_DN11SKdrA.text: Just had an amazing dinner! Of course, we enjoyed the garlic knots which lived up to the hype and we ordered the Pinny's supreme pizza. The pizza was delicious and they don't skimp on the toppings!  I love that the layout of the restaurant is simple and cozy - the decor and atmosphere made me feel right at home.  Also, Rosie was our server and she was absolutely amazing from start to finish. She is such a warm and genuine spirit and made my dining experience that much more memorable.  The quality of food is excellent and I'll be sure to make another visit soon! My hunt for amazing pizza on the west side has come to an end here at Pinny's!

jKqOGf12o5511yhinK4SeQ.text: I'm actually reluctant to mention this pizzeria but, since I'm not in Las Vegas often, I won't be bothered by not being able to get a table. There is a hidden gem, on west Sahara Boulevard, Papa Pinny's Pizzeria.  Last evening, we enjoyed a very expensive family meal. This evening, we were looking for a good Italian meal that wouldn't require a second mortgage. Frankly, I was hesitant to dine at a pizzeria because we wanted a sit-down meal and more than pizza. Papa Pinny's was a great choice.  From our salads, garlic knots and garlic bread starters, to our entrees, that included chicken marsala and salmon, everything was exceptional. Rosie, our server, was very attentive and made terrific recommendations. I rarely give five star ratings but Papa Pinny's deserves it. Be aware that the atmosphere is pure pizzeria with limited seating.   When we return to Las Vegas, Papa Pinny's is on our dining list.

bMviW_IhcMS5paRsabYu4w.text: great food.  long wait for delivery (65 min), but was worth the wait.  To their defense, it was on a saturday night so thats kind of expected. New to the area, but will definitely become a frequenter.

gfJ3J-Mb0ybZltWb6TrQ8w.text: Jessica was super awesome with here Service. She was pleasant and a sweet gal. Because of her I will return trying as much of the menus. I had the Chicken wings and it was the way they should be. Perfect, I was surprise by the presentation, I never expected it to be payed out just like the picture. Lol

Sucb-diOeotoot8EFeK4VQ.text: This is someplace to definitely check out. There is nothing better at times than a good pizza, and it's the service that also helps sells. My short trip here was made all the better as a friendly waiter was helpful and patient. This is worth the stop and if you're in the area you should stop by.

RntihHLkKxCxUSuJfWdHXA.text: Horrible Delivery! It took over an hour! Food was delivered cold and my sandwich was soggy. WILL NEVER ORDER FROM THEM AGAIN! I didn't want to leave any stars!!!

wD4xIBhB02P8YqrQ3mQHMQ.text: Decent pies, a ma' and pa' store Italian chi-town memorabilia (I think) small spot on the map. Pizza's not the best but edible when you haven't had nothing all day. Being from the east coast Manhattan, what I like to do sometimes is a slice taste test and It would've been cool if they had slices any hr instead only during lunch time specials. It was evening and needed a quick bite but had to settle for a small pie. They probably were running out of sauce cause the 12inch I ordered didn't had much and it was like a light spread coating, the dough and cheese is what filled me up instead. I should've ask to put it back in the oven and cook it more for a mild darker edge cause the crust was too softy bread white all around. Maybe if I'm across the way next time I'll go for a well done thin crust. The women behind the counter was courteous and friendly thou. It's aaiight as we say ..

1HnyS0WPrfEPCHV7DAT7xw.text: Excellent NY style pizza - I really like the Hawaiian and the garlic knots are great too. Also the people that work here are always super friendly and attentive. Definitely coming back!

T5i7gvHOsPcF5Mqz2nm9hQ.text: Had a large sausage, onion and garlic pizza and thought it was very good. Crust, cheese and sauce were just right. Would definitely return.

7ddOAS8w1O8PZaxNvw4qng.text: Great local spot! Definitely more than just a pizzeria...cozy, Italian restaurant, delicious food, great ambiance, and the owner is great! All of the food we ordered was delicious but my favorite was the garlic bread!!! Highly recommend this place!!!

oWQQtvC4iWJ56rU2Azgnbg.text: Soooo amazing!  May have found our new go to for pizza delivery!  Our  very picky teen called the food a religious experience! The pizza, stromboli and the Ooohhh my garlic knots! ! All must have!  Fast delivery too,  which rocks when you work nights, on the run, running late  and starving! Like tonight! Writing this while getting ready and anticipating food awesomeness!

3B8fgWHYyEvQs6LZCmAs8g.text: Not only is their pizza perfect and delicious, their customer service is amazing too. I ordered a 2 liter of soda but for whatever reason, it was forgotten for my delivery. After I asked about it and the driver confirmed it was on receipt and paid for, he actually left and came back when it within a few minutes. I can't that you enough for that steller service and and will be a loyal customer for life.

Yt9w5mAweoPZPEnLY2L0dA.text: Didn't get get the pizza I wanted and the Manager said their is nothing he can do. Fucking ridiculous.

jxfse3xdxUHmmlJQI5qRnQ.text: Decided to try a new pizza place. Glad we chose Papa Penny's Pizzeria! The dinner started off with bruschetta which is really good. I would have posted a pic, but it did not last long  enough to take it. We will be back for the bruschetta!   We ordered a Hawaiian pizza. It was loaded with pineapple. It was really good. Our kids got the cheese and pepperoni pizza, they both ate it up.   The waitress was really nice. The owner made sure we were happy with our meal, which we were!   We will be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IowK2hGJiTlljyiuYuO3hQ.text: Bravo. My boyfriend is a chef at a high end hotel on the strip and we both appreciate a clean kitchen and very yummy, fresh food.  Antipasto could have used a few more greens but it's hard to complain when the pizza is delicious and the meats and cheese are fresh.  We will be back!

wYA32E0M6zWOuKtEPg7CeA.text: This hole in the wall pizzeria is definitely worth checking out. Walking in you feel immediately welcome with a warm ambience and friendly staff. The options on the menu vary, both in food and price. I got an extra large supreme pizza for about $20 but they also offer many other Italian dishes. They also have a great happy hour! 2 for 1 wine or beer, half priced appetizers, and free tapas with wine or beer. The service was great. Papa Pinny himself came out and took very good care of us. All and all it was a great dining experience and I recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable date night!

5igtUfHxHJxWzcZP3dnTVA.text: Excellent! Love the food, service, and atmosphere!  No joke, stop by and try it yourself. New favorite spot!

TJDFMsB-OlJRIh8fB0j99A.text: I ordered a calzone from here, and a 3/5 is about right. The food was hot, the delivery was accomplished in time stated, and the crust was crisp and well-seasoned. But, the meat and cheese were overly greasy, and seemingly old ingredients. Basically the least important features of the experience were amazing, while the whole point (what you eat) failed to impress. Maybe it was an off day, might try it when I'm in the area sometime~

KWo7I0AAgigOsqT-nx56PA.text: This place exceeded my expectations when I set foot in the establishment. Jason, the owner of Papa's really caters to his guests. But that is just the start. Hands down, this has got to be the best pizza I have ever had in the Las Vegas Valley. Jason uses all the freshest, premium ingredients he can get his hands on. The quality proves itself over and over with each single bite of pizza!!  Will definitely be back for more.

9AHdw-IqgSj4-3xwLbr3Fg.text: I found this place quite by accident a few weeks ago.  I was in the same plaza getting an eye exam with my daughter and decided to stop in for lunch while we waited for our glasses to be finished.  I had not read any yelp reviews before going there.  Seating are clean and inviting.  You can see back into the kitchen which was equally clean.  Awesome!  We were greeted and waited on by the manager, Dave who made us feel welcome.  He told us about the place, how long they had been there, etc...  It was just pretty cool to chat with him.  I kept it pretty simple for my first time in, I got a 2 slice lunch special and my daughter got the spaghetti.  Both were amazing!  I have been back several times since but always get pizza, it is that great.  They do have a chef there, not a "cook" who makes some great looking dishes.  I have seen what others around me are eating and I keep saying I am going to try something different, but I always stick with what I know.  Also now, our friend Rosie works there! We know her from way back and the most friendliest person you can meet.    This is my new local pizza hang out.

0SP33XJIY_4X4GOFSkNfQQ.text: We get this delivered. It's always still hot when it arrives. Love the mozzarella sticks! Never ever have leftovers/ the boys devour it!

N7L5sE94vEiYQ3GJMGcbaw.text: This place is awesome. They communicated expectations clearly and the food was amazing. We had bruschetta, garlic knots and Pizza. Everything exceeded expectations. If you are a regular or visiting Vegas try this place out. You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Margherita is amazing!! Crust is crispy and flavorful. Toppings are fresh.

r2qrTFN9oC4VZpY9dSn3mQ.text: Me and my family love this place. The pizza the wings the fries, and the garlic knots  salad is pretty cool too. The delivery takes a little long considering I live 3 minutes away but worth it.

-Ru6htSyPEosVT8LXQHwKQ.text: I've been having really bad luck with pizza around Vegas lately but thankfully this place broke the bad trend. I just ordered delivery from this place and it was amazing!! The garlic knots are sooo good, i only wish i ordered more of them. The pizza was very good too. I got a cheese pizza with Italian sausage, jalapenos and garlic. I recommend it. It is more expensive for delivery with the $6 delivery fee, but I'd rather pay more for food that's actually good instead of having free delivery and crappy pizza lol Will order again

Il1OePTUOeuy3XuWbK6u4g.text: I had been really sick for a while, I really wanted authentic simple pasta! My husband makes pomodoro sauce and also a garlic basil olive oil sauce. I wanted one of those. They have both! I ordered both and the side salads were huge with quality ingredients! Both of the pastas were homemade, fresh and just like the real deal ( my husband is Italian)   Also they are really good about double checking the orders for special instructions. Their prices are very reasonable. Every time I've called the store they have been really nice and accommodating!

ptLBs4clX9hU-U82kX-dqg.text: This place is a hole in the wall spot! Never knew about it until I yelped whats around me. And thank god I found this place there pizza is really awesome! And the service is just as good! This is my 3rd time ordering now and haven't been disappointed yet! A definite must try! But the only problem is that they close at 9pm during the week .

wCg5TBzgIFPbgfLDDkXI8w.text: Food is great. Had spaghetti and meatballs. Husband had shrimp special. Like the splits of wine. Most placed don't store wine correctly. Definitely gourmet  not just a pizza place. Staff very friendly.

ehY34pNgU7O_AfquoTWW7g.text: As a transplant from Jersey where pizza is king I can say Papa PInny's is hands down my favorite pizza place in Vegas.....  Jason and his staff are the best and if there is even a slight issue they will go above and beyond to rectify it. I have even had him create a pizza not on his menu, that is how awesome he is.......

_F0F17luDIwhwq7k5ZnRiA.text: We order from Papa Pinny's quite regularly. Kids like the Stromboli, I love their Chicken Parmesan and the Hubs likes their Chicken Marsala. Love their white fish dinner, bummed they don't deliver it anymore. Overall their food is pretty good and consistent, delivery is usually pretty fast. Unfortunately though - they end up being very pricey for the amount of food, partly because their delivery fees are a little high. Good little Italian spot.

AdxD5keKczPeiFY5DlxjdQ.text: That's my first time here because one of my friend brought me here, the food was delicious, homemade and fresh. The service was awesome and I'll coming back at any time. I recommend the restaurant if you want to coming with your friend for really good Italian cuisine. They have the best tiramisu in town. We just love it.

32YdVyIdzzvTwfUMrqUGzg.text: This was literally a waste of time and money. Where do these great reviews come from?   I ordered eggplant parmesan and chicken marsala. It was as good as a frozen microwave meal.No real flavor or any depth to the sauces. We've pretty much had a couple of bites, ate the bread and the rest lingered in the fridge for days. Italian food never sits around in our home.   This was really a disappointing experience; pretty much the exact opposite of what was anticipated because of the reviews. I know we only had two dishes, could have been a bad day but do I really want to go for seconds? No, it was so unappetizing   In my opinion, I would not recommend this place to anyone. I am better off making my own as I have been.

p4ZCnh93TlNAWQ3xiW1Y1w.text: Excellent pizza!  We had the supreme, and it was very tasty. The staff was very friendly, asked how I had heard about them, and seemed pleased when I said that I had found them on Yelp. I highly recommend Papa Pinney's Pizzaria on West Sahara.

3iio30nQFxwMWRxVPUhjfQ.text: I waited 2 hours for a cold pizza. My house is 5 mins from the restaurant. Definetly off my list for food options now.

8K9IbO1NneGdK5m6jxm_sg.text: I took my family here for dinner. I had read the YELP reviews prior and thought I should stop in. We were very impressed as we entered. The restaurant and kitchen was very clean. There were large TV's mounted on the walls playing different sports.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. Jason F greeted us as we walked in, and explained the menu as well as their signature menu items.  The place had a relaxed atmosphere, and great food.    I ordered the eggplant Parmesan entree.  It came with pasta, along with a bread stick and a small salad... The house dressing was awesome!  We also ordered a cheese pizza for the kids, and a Cesar salad. The food was excellent, and priced well. We will definitely return to this restaurant.

7KPAQujNaZJcrdSknPRlig.text: Let me start by saying the food was average and the service and atmosphere were terrible. There are a few tables in the whole place so not a comfortable place to dine in by any means. Our waitress was an older Italian lady seemed like she was having a bad day. We were the only table in the place and we still had to get her attention to fill our drinks. In our opinion she should've retired 10 years ago. Maybe this place is better for delivery but in our opinion there are better Italian options in the area. Such as Roma deli for a great lunch or Nora's for great sit down dinner.

9QBzwveOG36OWKRHK6hfJw.text: Everything I've had here so far has been amazing! The pizza is by far my favorite and the garlic knots are out of this world! The cheese is stretchy and if you are more of a cheese person that a sauce person like myself then you will love it! I've had the philly sandwich and the sausage pepper sandwich. The everything pizza is my all time favorite! It weights like 10lbs!

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Literally heaven!!!! Chicken Alfredo pizza!
Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This pizza is so cheesy!!!! So bomb! You will not be disappointed!
Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The philly and the sausage pepper sandwich!

cRiyTPcBIzk4esKIZsaX5w.text: Mmmmmmm  The food is INCREDIBLE!!!! I work next door to Papa Pinny's, and we all eat there every day! My fiance and I are in love with our new spot! The personable staff and owners are so friendly and they open every pie and show you - then they admire their own work. It's a beautiful thing! They make you feel like family. If you're visiting Vegas, or are lucky enough to live here you should eat here. You WON'T be disappointed! If my fiance approves, then it's truly worth it. THEY HAVE AMAZING PASTAS, CAESAR and other SALADS, DESSERTS, AND PIZZA!!!!!!!!   Thank you guys for such a great experience, as always!!

OKHRW-dAdAyGDtV3IgqCKQ.text: Ridiculously good!  Nice restaurant and great atmosphere.  The pizza dough is so good!  Jason the owner takes great care of his customers and that is a huge plus.  Great food, awesome sorbet desert...WIN WIN choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bLspVrPbsHyfWc8PiF78hA.text: Big time fan of this place. I love pizza, and this rates up there with the best. Rediculously good crust and the toppings are on point. We pounded the pinny's signature supreme = amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pinny&#39;s signature supreme... Ridiculously good :)

Bns4xvht99pZv6MgRXnjwA.text: This is exactly what a dining experience should be like!! Came here on Thursday on a whim after leaving the Knights game. Upon entering I was taken back at how small it was, only about 12 tables and a 3 seat bar up front. Then my head exploded.  We were greeted by an exceptional waiter/counter person who  poured us homemade wine, kept great conversation, joked and kept working like it was his house. We ordered a pizza and the mushroom ravioli. While it cooked, the owner, Dave, came to us with fried polenta treats, more wine (his glass was gigantic) and kept up the conversation. It was fabulous. We took the food to go and the pizza was extraordinary!! The mushroom ravioli was great as well and the sauce it came in would make my hand taste great!!  We will be back to this place often!!

2pGNyNVe6hpij4Vh4Kuw7w.text: I made a reservation for a wednesday night for a friend's birthday. I came in early to give them a birthday cake and the host was extremely friendly. He sure knew how to read someone's energy. I tend to be very upbeat so he matched that attitude with enthusiasm. He took the cake and told me he'd see me in an hour (my reservation was for an hour later).   Came back with my friend and of course we got seated immediately. The decor inside this cute location definitely makes for a great date. The red and white tablecloths provided you with a True italian feel. The candles and dim lighting gave off such an alluring ambiance. It definitely slows down the pace and allows you to enjoy your meal. They had great music playing as well that matched the tone of the restaurant.   The host/waiter ( think his name was Victor) and poured my friend a glass of wine to celebrate his birthday. We ordered the caprese salad and got their medium supreme pizza.   The food came out with good timing. We had the salad first. Their tomatos were clearly fresh and organic. We enjoyed the mozzarella cheese that was used. The basil and balsamic sauce over the salad was perfect. Victor came by with some garlic bread to bring the salad together.  What a wonderful appetizer.   My friend and I are pretty big pizza lovers. We've definitely tried a variety of pizza places around Vegas. We bit into the supreme pizza slice that we ordered and it was heavenly. The crisp crunch and blend of the flavors on this pizza was wonderful. We were also satisfied with the pizza size.   Giovanni, the owner was walking around greeting people. He stopped by our table and greeted us. He said happy birthday to my friend and even offered their specially homemade new york cheesecake with ricotta cheese.   They came out with the cheesecakes and sang happybirthday to my friend. We asked for our check and finished up.   Honestly, the restaurant and the staff just felt like home. It felt like we were stepping into someone's home and they were just treated us like family. I hope to come back with more friends and continue to explore the menu.  Thank you for having us over!

yoPyQCUwl_7wd-CsG-9ZPQ.text: Best garlic knots and tiramisu I've ever had in my life . Wine and coffee not so much and pizza was okay

RoRs7Gx9jPOgpv4g-KqfRw.text: Food was delicious, we tried the calamari, the caprese salad.  Chicken and eggplant parmesan we're very good and filling.  We also had the colossal cheese pizza which 4 people ate and we had a few pieces to take home.   The service was good.  The owner is a little qwirky but very hospitable.  They had a packed House on a Saturday night and did their best to accommodate everyone quickly, yet spent time talking to everyone.

dGA2afk57Sgz2LX1h1H79A.text: Papa Pinnys is a small cozy place. The pizza is around $30.00 but there are little coupons on the box. If you collect about 10 you get a free pizza.  The pizza is delicious and they are generous with the toppings. I'll typically start with the knots which are pretty amazing! They have minced garlic on the top with I think some olive oil. I don't waste any of it ! If some of it falls off I save it to put on my pizza. I love ...love garlic!   The customer service is great! I brought  coupons with me the server let me know which one would be the most beneficial.  My drink was also topped off often so that is always a plus for me. When you are thinking about ordering from a pizza chain I would suggest trying this place out! I like trying new things instead of eating the same old pizza. The knots are worth the trip alone!

photos.caption: Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giovanni's Hole In The Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The knots!

n8JK_uiHvMKe3NhQklSTFw.text: Their chicken Caesar salad is bomb, I just wish it were a larger portion for the price we paid. I'm glad we found this place, I'll be back to try their pasta next time.

wY-e8As-ZaZ7xPwWOYIwBA.text: WOW! Can't say enough about this place.  We were a party of 6 (part of our hockey team that was in for a tournament from Houston) and I looked at yelp to find a place to eat close to our Air BnB. I said "hole in the wall? its gotta be good!" and when we walked in and saw how small it was we were worried about out size being accommodated or just being those diffract customers none of us want to be. They immediately took us and moved some things around to make sure we were seated. Giovanni welcomed us and had such a great attitude and sense of humor. We had decided to splurge and so glad we did. The garlic knots were out of this world and the house wine was pretty good (not to mention the fantastically large glasses!). We had the calamari and caprise salad for appetizers - so good! Everyone loved their main dishes (lasagna, eggplant parm, two steaks (WOW- so good), ravioli) and we raved for days to the rest of our teammates. Giovanni sold us on the dessert with his description and since we had decided we were splurging we went for it (ordered three for the table) and OM MY! - decadent....  We felt so comfortable and at home due to the atmosphere and the service, not to mention Giovannis personality just makes you feel like family.   I spoke to Giovanni about having a team party there next year, thinking we might fill the whole restaurant as there are 20 of us and he said not a problem! We will definitely be back next year and maybe more than once!   This hidden gem is a must go for locals and visitors alike - I promise you will not be disappointed!

z2B3MUcOg9qSM-CF5HBbzQ.text: We ordered lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs. The lasagna was okay, but not quite as good as we make at home. The spaghetti was served al dente with a spicy sauce. The meatballs were large and tasty. The atmosphere was fun. With melted candles in old Chianti bottles with an Italian aura. The restaurant is small and seems to cater to take out primarily.

4YXyCCDpCg5rnwBvAD9vBg.text: A very nice casual & intimate dining venue in a strip mall. We enjoyed traditional NY-style Italian cuisine by candlelight, serenaded by violin at tableside. My wife had shrimp scampi & I had the crispy-style eggplant parmigiana. The servings were generous & tasty! We will be back.

58I2hZgkxkUeAQu80mjkaw.text: Best Caprese salad we ever had here in Vegas. Its one of the legit and best pizza and pasta here. The service and the food is awesome. We wanted to ask the owner if we can celebrate our wedding here such a cool and awesome place. Keep it up, one day it will be bigger place
