u7MFro3sOwquAYjUWKA_Vg.text: We went to Giovanni's hole in the wall after reading a yelp review . The food was excellent, the server was prompt and the atmosphere was great! The owner came by our table twice to make sure all was well.  We had strawberry cheese cake for desert which was very creamy and light. We'll go back again!

uwP6XsRKH1fSwxlndOZsxg.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in town. My boyfriend and I have been several times and gotten different dishes, and everything we've had has been superb. The owners are usually around as well, and they are super fun. A great neighborhood restaurant. The restaurant seating is limited, but I think it only adds to the vibe. I also highly recommend the house wine!

z5aVJbryijfJUHiG2C5Lhw.text: Must have been in some twilight zone version when I went- the service was THE WORST that I have ever experienced in any restaurant ever.   I just deleted a lengthy explanation but wiped it  - I will not be returning here.  If you enjoy being told that the server never gets anything wrong (so that you, the customer, must be wrong to dare suggest that you did, in fact, not order what the server rather rudely delivered to the table), and when a fix may have been super simple but alas, was not even attempted... Nah.   Not going back

HXHT6zZh9qvD7jMUh0ztWQ.text: Really Great Experience. Giovanni is a funny guy. The health district came in and gave Giovanni a C for their health score and Giovanni plastered the sign all across his restaurant and invited Dirty Dining to come and fight against it. The episode will air this Wednesday at 11pm. We had the privilege of staying and eating in the restaurant while all of this was going on.   Based on past experiences and their quality of food, I would say they are an A for cleanliness and food preparation. I think the health inspectors dinged them for the number of chairs in the cramped restaurant (it's a hole in the wall) and also, they only have one server or waitress taking orders for everyone. I can see how they would lose points for that as well, as things might be left on the counter for a few minutes, so they can help another customer.  Giovanni has been nothing but courteous and friendly. His staff is extremely nice too. This place has the best Italian food I've ever had, and their cheesecake is top notch (blows cheesecake factory out of the water). Apparently, Giovanni stays until 2am everynight to make it fresh. He only sells it by the slice because he runs out of stock fast. He's given us a gift card each time to offset the wait and to give excellent customer service. I am going to nominate him and his business for Customer Service Excellence with the Las Vegas Metro Chamber Of Commerce because they simply are one of the best in Vegas! That way Giovanni will have something that is TRUTHFUL to hang on his walls for his AMAZING food and EXCELLENT customer service instead of the joke C-grade inspection the money-grabbing health district put on his little restaurant. It's very rare to be in a restaurant where the owner cooks and eats with your family. You know Giovanni really cares about his food, his reputation, and his customers, and that makes this place one of the best dining experiences in Vegas.

E8m-DeNB5imhPuQ3wcFS_w.text: My daughter and I love this hidden little gem. The service is always on par and the food very consistent and tasty. We haven't had a bad meal here since our first visit and we had to have visited this place at least a half a dozen times. We strongly recommend this place for its service and tasty food. Not to mention that it has a pretty nice vibe to it.

AgW6efHbFBTgNDqSV6bMDw.text: Small place, first thing when you walk in is you see a guy playing the keyboard. Dining music made the dining experience great. Very homey setting, with candles in wine bottles with wax drippings on the sides, checkered table cloths and wine and wine glasses. We ordered calzone which was huge, stuffed with cheese, pepperoni and mushrooms. Lasagna which was delicious and eggplant parmesan.  We also got garlic knots which was a little overdone but still delicious and homemade cheesecake for dessert which was creamy, rich and sensational.  This little place is definitely worth checking out. Our waitress Shanna was very friendly and attentive to our needs. We definitely will spread the word that this place is a must go to eat place when hungry for Italian food. We will be back

YcjvZEM51dYXNnfFIv7ccQ.text: Where to start?  The comfy atmosphere where you feel like part of the family to the great house wine served in his aquarium size wine glasses.   And then there's the food!   The marinara is the best in Las Vegas.  We've been there a few times and always try something new.   Everything is delicious.  We always start with his house salad which is fresh greens topped with a zingy vinaigrette served with garlicky knots.  And last night we tried the pizza.  Wow.  Hand tossed and baked perfectly.  Lots of toppings but not soggy.  We tried the cheesecake and it's not the usual but a wonderful blend of cheeses.   Still trying to identify what kinds........  But I saved the best for last:  Giovanni.  He greets you at the door and makes you feel like you're a family member.    This is a place you really need to try.   Family or couples it's absolutely wonderful!

_ns7uQi1G88Ud_jNIopvAA.text: Pretty darn good.  My family was visiting the area for a sporting event weekend and my husband found this place.  Be warned, it really IS a hole in the wall.  It seemed like the kitchen was larger than the seating area where I would guess there is seating for 20 total inside.  Our experience was that the food was delicious, the service so-so, and the atmosphere charming.  After greetings us like old friends, Giovanni poured us all a glass of wine that was delicious!  I never learned, but we assumed it was their house wine.  We ordered the calamari appetizer and was such a generous portion!  The three of us typically fight over the meager quantity, but there was no need at Giovanni's.  And it was served with nummy marinara too.  I ordered mozzarella sticks but received the caprese salad instead.I tried to get Giovanni's attention to make sure he meant for me to have the salad but gave up after a while.   Taking this as a sign that I should have chosen healthier than mozzarella sticks anyway, my husband and I enjoyed the salad.   We also all enjoyed our main courses: steak Napoli for my husband who just raved over the sauce, broccoli chicken for my teenage son who thought it was good, and eggplant parmagiana for me and it was delicious too.  The food was good but I didn't get my requested water until the end of the meal.  I think I heard that they were short staffed that night so patience was a little necessary.   I almost forgot to mention the live music (we went on a Friday night) and it was really good and added to the whole atmosphere.

0JR5Gt9yM2vTcjfD_SDUKg.text: This is an edit to my first review.  Papa Pinny's was very courteous, and gave me a credit for a new pizza.  This time the pizza was excellent.  The crust crispy, and well done.  The pizza toppings were fresh and flavorful.  I am very glad I gave Papa Pinny's another chance, it was well worth it.  Definitely will order Papa Pinny's again.  Just got a soggy pizza delivered after waiting for it for an hour.  It's like the crust was drenched in water, no crisp to the crust what so ever.  Total disappointment! Especially for the $26 price tag.

x07Q_-Nze9gDYKHrt2ysYA.text: My family and I stopped in to have dinner and we had a great first experience. My wife and I shared shared a Calzone, kids had pizza. They finished the first, so we had to order a second one. Finally, a huge serving of Tiramisu to share. Everything was delicious!! Especially the tiramisu!! Thanks to our waitress and Papa Pinny himself for a memorable evening!!   We will definitely be back!

sRufYBq79rZzlS4gZVNFPw.text: Small, family owned restaurant where there are two TV's and the kitchen is visible.   Ordered their chicken piccata to go. I like that they didn't skimp on the portions of pasta and chicken. My only wish the next time I order would be for more capers & less butter.

JiAnjm8FdKsd5lwqbwBKLQ.text: I don't know how this place got so many good reviews, it must be all of their friends. It doesn't even come close to Rocco's pizza Summerlin location (across from Red Rock Casino)  The 4 cheese pizza was way way too salty, with too much sauce which was overly acidic. The fettuccine Alfredo had no taste and the sauce tasted like it came from a can. The grilled chicken in the Alfredo was the only thing that saved the dish and was pretty good. We also had a side of meatballs which the sauce also tasted like it came straight out of a can. They were also way too salty and didn't have much flavor. The texture was also not great.   Nora's or Gino's has much better pasta. Rocco's for pizza.

fv2msKNluzmXUPBq8EwG1Q.text: Ordered take out from this place had the four cheese pizza pie which was extremely salty way too much tomato sauce and crust sucked. Had 2 slice and threw out the rest it was not edible. I also had the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken pasta was heavy in cream sauce. It was ok. The grilled chicken was good. The garlic bread was dry. Wife had the meatballs and she said it sucked as well.  I won't be going there again!!!

C1nG-lAD1TKsyjv3XeOzfw.text: We came here expecting some fast food, but stayed for a great experience. All of the food was delicious and the host made sure we were getting great service and enjoying ourselves. Everyone serving is friendly and welcoming. The cheesecake is homemade and tastes amazing. I would visit again.

3vRJWRkkPDxfeO2rfhbUow.text: Nothing but 'wonderful' for this pizzeria. Best service, good price, and delicious pizza! Spot on pizza margherita; the pizza crust had a wonderful taste, the sauce was devine, and toppings were perfect. I don't normally eat a lot of pizza all at once, but with this one I couldn't stop eating more. The kids enjoyed their pizza, as well. We will be returning and make this our go-to for pizza.   Finally found the right pizza place in the Summerlin area! Just wish we found it sooner. I must repeat one last thing, excellent customer service.

n2ConL4PkG7hImaBAnIImg.text: Wow that was weird!  :-P  I just placed an order for delivery from Papa Pinny's and the subtotal without tax or anything added on was $23.  With tax and everything else it came to $29.  I asked to apply a coupon that came attached to their menu for $3 off a $20 order because it qualified by $3 and change.    The cashier is new and needed to call her boss Jason (or James?) in order to apply the discount.  After a prolonged hold she told me that they would NOT honor the coupon because the taxes can't count toward the order.    I told her that answer didn't make any sense, and reconfirmed that my subtotal was $23 without taxes, which should amply qualify my order for the coupon.  She agreed.  I asked to speak with her boss but she said he wasn't there, she had to call him on the phone.    Rather than wait another 20 minutes to get the food underway I just put the order on my card without the discount and told her that I would Yelp it.  I'm blown away that in this age of Yelp and Social Media, a pizza joint would refuse to honor their own coupon.

k4wc4C7vrmRtfbhKhTlJHg.text: Was in this restaurant today and witnessed an employee  ,say racial comments to a uber eats driver ,was so rude right in front of me ! Saying he doesn't serve mexicans!!!!! I am mexican American! !! Was so offened i will never patronize  this establishment  again !!!! Talk about classless made the poor ladie cry !!!! How come he didn't  say that to me?? I wasn't gonna let my kids hear the comotion so i ignored it ,but i  had to let you folks  know!!!!

iEhWc1fpLOO12xWMn8RLzQ.text: Trying hard to find a great family pizzeria that we can return to often...  we ordered here the other night and we're going to tonight as well.  Very much enjoyed the food the other day.  Ordered mozzarella sticks and a cheese pizza (YUM!!!) and got a 1/2-1/2 meat loves and Hawaiian  which was a great choice with plenty of flavor, ingredients, cheese as well as plenty of residual greases from all.  This was deliciously satisfying to everyone here.   Even the left over pizza that was hurriedly warmed in the counter top oven the next day was a treat.   Will be coming back I'm sure...

EKKzvAe25r90ZzoTK9lb3w.text: First time here.  Greeted by Mr. Giovanni himself.  The atmosphere felt like we entered his home.  Live Italian music filled the whole place.   It was like you seen in the movies.  Since it was our first time I asked Mr. Giovanni what's the specialty and he recommended and explained several dishes.  My wife chose the Steak and Lobster and I had the Fettuccine Chicken Alfredo.  OMG!  Excellent!  Finished off the meals with thr New York Cheesecake.  Yum! j27OnoAIjiYcqMZ9bd_zHA.text: Those garlic knots... o m g. I don't know what they put in the sauce they serve with them but I want to swim in it. I hope this is the sauce they serve on everything, I can't wait to try some more dishes.  This time, we got the Philly cheese steak and the Italian beef. They were both excellent. PqrvLfIwwv30RTsthQsp7g.text: I'm from Chicago. Needless to say what I expect from a pizza place. My girlfriend and I have ordered here twice now. The first time was excellent! The second time we ordered a plain cheese pizza to be delivered. And it took nearly an hour and a half on a Tuesday night. When we received the pizza it looked like the driver did donuts in the parking lot and gave it to us. I'm giving it a 4 star rating because when we called to complain they were very kind and rushed the second pizza to us in 20 minutes. The owner delivered it himself and allowed us to keep the previous pizza as well. Customer service goes a long way in my book. We'll order again.

N6rY2-mUjTwL1V5eb9_4_g.text: We ordered the garlic knots, lasagna, fettuccine alfredo, chicken parmesan, white pizza and a pepperoni/sausage pizza. Every single dish was fantastic. The garlic knots had an amazing flavor and the texture was divine. Highly recommend the garlic knots. The pizza crust was cooked perfectly and the cheese on the pizza was the best we've ever tasted. Chicken was tender and the alfredo sauce was creamy and consistent. Best meal in Vegas. Highly recommend this place.

CGQ9L6s8UVhFdLouIXak7Q.text: Super friendly staff and a great calzone! Absolutely will be back to sample more of their menu!

XHaCuzEyJ7j-m4IwhuCmgA.text: First time here on a Yelp recommendation! Super cute restaurant, met the owner Annie - can't wait to come back. FcHpviFYIVQ-VUElgvGqpw.text: We like to support mom and pop businesses and gave this place a shot. The service was slow, very slow. The salad was bland - was there any salad dressing on it? Drinks were served with plastic straws (both for water glasses and soda glasses). A diet drink had two straws in it to signify which glass was diet. Talk about non-environmentally friendly!   It took 40 minutes to get our food order - unbelievable considering there are only a handful of tables in the entire restaurant. And by a "handful", I mean 5-6 total tables!  The eggplant parmesan dish was so-so; a bit undercooked. The four-cheese pizza didn't have enough pizza sauce on it, even though we asked for extra sauce. Condiments (specifically the peppercorns) were provided in a half-empty container. We asked for basic Italian bread with our spaghetti and they only could provide garlic knots. The table was so small, we barely could fit the pizza, eggplant dish, drink glasses and our eating plates.    The experience here was well under our lowest expectations, and so far below, it doesn't even deserve to be called a Hole-in-the-Wall.  "Hole-in-the-walls" usually have enough character to elicit a fun experience which you want to share with friends and family.  Not here.

VMStrIwoH9FgRyTmr61b9g.text: So disappointed. I was craving Pasta and pizza last night and decided on this place based upon the good reviews.   Not sure if I came on a bad night but it was terrible. Perhaps the worst I've had in Vegas since living here. I got the Chicken Marsala w fettuccine and a small supreme pizza.   The Chicken Marsala barely had any sauce, flavor and the chicken was extremely dry. It tasted like a microwave dinner. The pizza was beyond lackluster in any flavor and sauce.   It literally felt as though I threw $35 dollars into the trash can.  What a waste, the people who worked there were very nice and friendly.

7NQmCVEMvE3qF01VIe4K8A.text: This is a cute little hole in the wall with a lot of charm.  My husband I walked in a few months ago.  It was packed but they squeezed us in. Last night we returned with our 14 year old daughter.  She also really enjoyed the meal and restaurant.    The table wine is not finest but drinkable and certainly fun to have poured by the glass from the table.   There is not a doubt that we will be back.

0j5BPiCCyfSKv8Z9QuVeZQ.text: My boyfriend decided to surprise me with going to Giovanni's Hole in the Wall, Sunday, at 4:00 P.M. He saw all of the rave reviews for Giovanni's Hole In The Wall and decided to bring me there.  As soon as we walked in, we noticed the tables were not properly setup. The waitress came over and provided us seating at a round table. It was not properly evened out and was wobbly. There was no table placing, no silverware, or napkins for us initially until after our appetizers arrived.  We had ordered the following  10 Garlic Knots White-Pizza [Small] Spaghetti and Meatballs Chicken Alfredo (We originally asked for Lasagna, but they were out of the Lasagna).   Typically, a lot of Italian places comes with just bread and butter for the table. I had asked the waitress, and she said their restaurant doesn't do that. It also was extremely hot in the restaurant. Their AC wasn't working properly. It felt like it was about 90 degrees inside.  The appetizers came out [2] salads and the garlic knots. The salads were a mixture of spinach, and romaine lettuce, a typically garden salad, with a Italian/lemon vinaigrette topped with mozzarella. It was okay. I didn't care for the lemon vinaigrette dressing. It had too much lemon for a Italian flavored dressing.  The garlic knots were under-cooked. In the middle of the garlic knots was dough that wasn't cooked all of the way. We finally had to ask for table placements to the waitress.  Our food came out shortly afterwards.   The Spaghetti and Meatballs was under-flavored. It needed more salt. The sauce tasted like it came from a can jar, then actually home-made. The Meatballs were a little too spicy. There was jalapenos in the meatballs which made it pretty much inedible for me. My kids couldn't eat it either.   The Chicken Alfredo lacked flavoring and seasons as well. It tasted more of a Parmesan and butter sauce. The chicken in the Chicken Alfredo was overcooked and tasted rubbery.  The White Pizza was uneventful. There was way too much cheese on the White Pizza that you could taste any other ingredient on it. The dough in the middle was under-cooked because there was too much ingredients on the pizza. The meal was quite expensive as well, coming out to $70.00. I don't plan on coming back to Giovanni's Hole In the Wall.

Dinner (chicken fettuccine) came with salad & bread, which was great!!  Our server was attentive to our table.  The only con would be the background music, it didn't fit the atmosphere. qnbbvQ9pyOKPT-JwQ2oDyg.text: Great atmosphere! They greeted us and sat us down quickly. The pizza is fresh with fresh toppings. We ordered supreme pizza and garlic knots. 6RVlsVGkey7zeCj4VNFYCA.text: Another great hole in the wall Italian Restaurant- no pun intended.    Owner/chef is very friendly.    Waiter is attentive and refilled our drinks quickly.   Let's talk about the pasta dishes.  My son enjoyed their fettuccine Alfredo- right textures.   Lasagna as advertised the best in town- I would say it might be.  It was delicious, gooey, cheesy, and hot.    Pizza is almost like New York style.     Desserts are in house and you can tell it's a family recipe.  New York cheesecake is yummy. Cannoli is pretty authentic- could have filling.  Tiramisu was delicious.

7E0bgVoFm0L1gWt9d-G44A.text: Well we were pleasantly surprised . My husband thought it was just a pizza place . Looked at menu and decided to try.  Upon entering the place it was small but cozy .  We were offered the house wine by glass or bottle . We sampled the red hummmm a bit sweet n cribari like . The waitress was very apologetic about wine.  We ordered from a very wide selection of dinners. The crispy eggplant Park & chicken parm. Both came with pasta and very large portions. House salad was crisp n cold.  I asked a couple that was leaving if they enjoyed the meal . She said best meatballs n pasta . He said he had chicken parm and after a few glasses the wine got better.  Will try this place again for sure . I'm hoping we can bring a good wine in with corkage fee.  I gave it 4 stars only because of the vino.

f42o2m668JGynFrj88rQtw.text: Giovanni's looks quite ordinary from afar, but as soon as you reach the entrance, you see tables draped in traditional cloth and the candles melting over glass bottles that you see in the restaurants across Italy.  When we stepped inside, we realised exactly why the restaurant was given the name that it had. The space itself is very small, however the owner has done a great job in avoiding making it seem cramped and the space is used very well.   The restaurant itself is so unique and interesting! There's so much to look at, from the art on the walls that add some culture and colour to the space and the people that fill it! Our server - a young man - was very friendly and accommodating and a man I believe to be the owner (with a very large glass of wine!) came over to welcome us and made us feel at home. They strike the right balance between being friendly and hands on, but also leaving you to enjoy your evening.  The food itself was also delicious!! We went for the ultimate pizza to share (basically all toppings) and it was so good!! You can order by the slice or from 12 up to 20" pizzas I believe. Crispy crust, not overly greasy and full of flavour. Food came out quite quickly and in the meantime, the owner made sure we had enough drinks flowing and some garlic bread to snack on.  We wished we could have managed one of their homemade desserts or shared another entree but with full stomachs, there will always be a next time!  Can't wait to return!

C_1syUYcMn8ctd0HnPAwCw.text: Overall:  OUTSTANDING!  We went late this morning for lunch with 6 adults and a toddler and were seated right away.  Be advised, the dining area is relatively small, so if they get busy, there might be a wait.  The highlight of the visit was the gentleman who served us today, as well as helped cook.  He was FANTASTIC!  Always stopping by to check on us and getting whatever we needed immediately, give him a raise.  He also mentioned his busser called out, so he was doing double duty.  The food was excellent.  We ordered mozz sticks, the Bigga steak & lobster ($26, includes sauce and pasta), chicken parm sandwich, lasagna, shrimp & lobster ravioli, Mardi Gras pasta (I think) and mushroom ravioli.  All of the items were fresh, well prepared and very tasty.  The steak and lobster value cannot be beat anywhere, any time.   Do not miss an opportunity to visit this spot, it was great!

5o_E88sPaRMBdFU-exFzZA.text: I love the taste of their crust, it's thin, and crispy.  There's other places I've been to in Rhode Island that remind me of the same perfect crispy crust.  The pepperoni pizza I had was greasy but exactly how I prefer it, dripping.  The mozzarella cheese is excellent quality.  The consistency of the service has been great both visits here.  The chief is a well spoken, understanding person and takes pride in his cooking.  May 19th at 2:30 PM was my first time here.  I chose to dine in with my friend from Rhode Island in town.  I had ordered a Philly cheesesteak with mushrooms & peppers it was really good! I didn't snap a picture because it was so good to split.   Last night (June 4th 8 PM) I placed a pick up order for large pepperoni pizza because hubby was getting out from work.  Honestly we loved it to go too!  I see some reviews complaining about soggy salad for delivery when it's difficult to transport cold items with hot items.  I would suggest sticking with hot food if you request delivery.  If not, you should definitely dine like we did our first visit.  Very nice tables and furniture to get comfortable.  I love this cozy place. It's 7 minutes from our house.

Tlqq_ogHSJvI5nYcuT3TAw.text: What an amazing experience. Home made house wine house salad knots and home made burgundy mushroom ravioli. I will tell you about the cheese cake next time I come. It looked amazing but I was stuffed. This is a True hole in the wall some how when you walk in the service, smells and food make you feel like you're your favorite restaurant with your family/loved ones (and I went by myself). It was highly  advised to make reservations but given that i went alone I did not and was seated promptly. Service was very quick and the perfect amount of friendly. Home made ravioli (to die for) comes w knots and house salad which were also sensational. Not too salty but very flavorful. So excited to return. Can't wait until my fam visits and I can bring them here.  Till then i will continue to explore then menunext stop cheesecake.

Vwecf2k5pOCxmvIwicW20g.text: This place is AMAZING!! We discovered this "hole in the wall" a few months back. We heard about it and decided since it's so close to home, let's try it! So glad we did! The place is definitely small as it used to be a pizza place, so don't expect a large restaurant. Let's get right to the food, my all time favorite is Chicken Picatta, so delicious. My husband loves his homemade lasagna, eggplant Parmesan New York style, chicken marsala, and amongst many other things that I don't recall!  His calamari appetizer is a nice huge portion very  delicate, not tough or chewy. Then there's his homemade cheesecake, it's the best I've ever had!

iRE-4yGUEa0oP7WvqQWiKg.text: I dined here a few nights ago with a few friends and their kids. I work in the restaurant industry and I'm not a parent. First off, the kids were not screaming. If you're in a dinky congested small space that can't even seat 40 people, one kid will seem overwhelming as it is. Welp, we had three! Get over it. The owner wants to be accommodating to who he wants to serve. As a business owner, anyone who comes out of their way to spend money on your business, you should be appreciative and learn when to shut the fuck up. We aren't looking for a pity sympathetic comp. We are simply calling you out for being a straight up asshole. I tipped the server accordingly because I know it's hard to clean after kids in the restaurant.   Obviously, the owner is a brat since he wants to pick and choose who can eat at his shithole in the wall. In other negative reviews, he calls the servers he hires baffoons. What the fuck?  Parents shouldn't be limited to options because an establishment can't handle children. Anyway, the eggplant, ravioli, calzone and our server compensated the awkward dining experience. Chuck E Cheese does have better pizza and they are 10000x welcoming for kids, but we felt like wasting our time and ruining your biased ambiance.

x0_3U0A7NxfsXfUs1acPkQ.text: First time here and love it! The ambiance is really nice and the service by Seth is great  He's funny, professional and attentive. The pizza is awesome! Crunchy, cooked through and oiled to my liking. Old school atmosphere with old school music. Highly recommend it!

7cAbVru_tzTSPVp4y-JcwQ.text: I stopped by this great hidden gem last night for dinner and immediately had a big smile on my face that stayed on until I left. The small quaint little restaurant is a True experience I Got the Whole New York feel by being that it's small compact the seating area for the restaurant is smaller than the kitchen which means the guy is truly focused on putting out a quality product. I had the chicken puttanesca that was preceded by a great salad with homemade Italian dressing. Great flavors lots of olives and capers the chicken was cooked perfectly moist with a great marinara sauce shaved Parmesan on top. It was all over top of wonderful linguine that was cooked and made fresh. Giovanni stopped by to chat with me several time with his near magnum sized cabernet wine glass. He gave me a free taste of his incredible cheesecake that was the best I had in 10 years. I now have to explore the entire menu and will be back soon to do a job well done.

ESqDIX9UX7wi5j1fuOCOuQ.text: Also called: Giovanni's Hole in the Wall. On the SE corner of Sahara and Cimarron. Wow! My wife got the lobster and shrimp pasta dish ($17) and I was hungry after a bike ride and got the chicken parm. for dinner ($15). There is just something wonderful when you love the sauces and flavors. They came out just right. Both dishes came with a nice dark green salad and garlic bread; mine also came with a side of spaghetti. Wife's lobster and shrimp pasta had a super generous amount of big shrimp and lobster both of which were very flavorful. We left with half the food for breakfast the next day. The big $5 glass or red wine was also quite good. It's a very small restaurant with a nice quiet ambience. We will be back enthusiastically.

R_9Lw3QERL00CRxzov2YGQ.text: Wow, wow and wow. I was extremely impressed with the high level of customer service. I was ready to give a 5 Star review before eating!! It's a small hole in the wall family owned place. Exactly what we were looking for. We ordered off the website and picked up and it was ready at the exact minute it said it would be. The gentleman in there went above and beyond welcoming us, checking our order and making small talk.   It is a little pricy and I wish there were available coupons or coupon codes. The pizza was a little greasy but delicious reminds me of my hometown NY. NY pizza is hard to find out here so I was surprised. The gluten free pizza was delicious and cooked to perfection.   The wings are a great traditional wings!! Will defiantly be back when I'm visiting again!

d0xxCxGaPZKxQ2Vb8tWl6g.text: I could make this a blog about pizza. Don't worry, I'll try to restrain myself!  I ordered a 12" pizza from Papa Pinny's Pizzeria, thru UberEATS (sorry, Yelp!). It is the first time I've ordered from them. I had a 12" pizza with black olives, fresh garlic, anchovies, and shrimp. Loved the garlic, but it was very strong, so consider that if your date isn't gonna eat it with you!  I choose Papa Pinney's because 1. I'd never tried them before, 2. My usual go-tos were all closed, 3. They offer shrimp as a topping, one of the few places in Las Vegas that do, and 4. I always like to try new places. I'm constantly in search of the best!  Papa Pinney's pleasantly surprised me. A True New York style pizza, with a crusty rim but soft under crust, perfect for folding; a very fresh-tasting tomato sauce, and nice, melty Italian cheeses. I put it in a 250 oven for a few minutes, box and all, when it arrived, because delivery pizza inevitably ends up being delivered lukewarm. It was delicious!  I subtracted one star for two reasons: Their smallest pizza is a 12", way too big for two people with small appetites and smaller wallets (although I'm betting this very good pizza will be great tomorrow, too); and although I'm thankful for the shrimp, please, Papa Pinney, remove the tails from the shrimp and chop them up, so I can have a bite of shrimp with each mouthful!  A hearty recommendation for this local pizzeria. If they chop the shrimp and offer a 10" pizza, I'll upgrade my review to five stars!

JMSrAZ8Saasehi3d9lywzw.text: I was at the store next to this pizzeria to get a gift with my 3 year old baby girl for my stepdads bday when all of a sudden I hear her say, "Mommy, I need to go bathroom." The store I was in did not have a public restroom so I went next door to this pizzeria where their bathroom was locked. I looked at the older woman who seemed nice that was there and said, " I'm so sorry but my 3 year old needs to go potty." Where she replied, "It's only for customers." So i said, "she's only 3" like really what harm could it have done to them? Now I understand how there are places with this policy, but I don't understand how you can say that when you see a toddler that needs to use the restroom. As I was walking out the man putting the pizza together in the background felt the need to yell "It's only for customers" which was not necessary since I was already walking out the door. Honestly had they let my baby girl use their bathroom I would have gladly repaid that kindness by purchasing something as a thank you..I almost mentioned it too but it all felt so wrong I could not wait to get out of there plus I didn't want my toddler to pee on herself. You will never have a customer out of me.. you may not care about that either but it's sad how people no longer have compassion... God bless you guys just the same.

-U8ncXIqb68hOPObehX8fA.text: A friend and I had a coupon for a BOGO pizza, so we thought we would give it a shot.  Glad we did.  Pizza was excellent.  Papa Pinny himself was there, and gave us some complimentary garlic bread while we waited for our pizza.  We ordered the meat lovers and the white pizzas.  The meat lovers had a generous amount of meat and a delicious, slightly sweet sauce.  The white pizza was equally amazing, bursting with garlic.  Papa even gave us a complimentary piece of his homemade cheesecake.  This is a MUST if you eat here.  Rich and creamy, with a fresh taste from the lemon zest in the filling.  I will definitely order from here again!

WFDhy2mzl3CPpk7Qt-XCTQ.text: Had the pleasure of feasting on an amazing meal here on 8/23. Its a small, quaint hole in the wall, as stated in the name, but, man the food...there is nothing quaint and small about it. I ordered a bone in Ribeye steak cooked medium well...and OMG, absolute perfection! It came with a brandy mushroom sauce atop the steak and damn if that didn't make even that much more better. Not over powering at all, a nice sudle, but flavorful sauce. This is an off strip restaurant, but so worth the short drive off the strip to get an amazing meal for a low price. My ribeye & lobster tail dinner was ONLY $25...an easy $60 to $75 meal. Don't be surprised if the owner walks around with his extremely large wine glass that easily can hold a bottle of wine. Oh yes, the red house wine is pretty good too. A perfect pairing with red meat.

h5hfl-7YGAIIi1rHjcC_5A.text: This place is awesome - the food was delicious. I came in with my two kids to have a quick lunch and was greeted by the friendly staff.   There was a football game on, but one of the staff members changed the channel for my son to watch cartoons while we waited for our food and after we finished eating, he helped me carry my leftovers since my hands were full.   I ordered a small cheese pizza, fries, and an Italian sub - simple, yet satisfying.  I'll be coming back whenever I visit Vegas!

ZGuulQF_zTeYfP1GcpDpJw.text: Wonderful ambience. Excellent food everything from pizza, pasta, lasagne, steaks etc! All homemade authentic Italian cuisine! And supreme customer service!!! Giovanni's Hole in the Wall is a 'have to' try! You won't be disappointed. Our faves were the Mardi Gras Alfredo pasta, bone-in ribeye with mushroom brandy, THE HOUSE BREAD, and the NY cheesesteak!!!

l9_l1GsUaJ5SlQBJT6muiA.text: Just left for an order of pizza.  What a wonderful staff.  Great service.  Visiting my parents from out of town and wanted to try something new.  Stopped in after laser tag next door and wow!!  The staff gave us free wine and the most amazing homemade cheesecake as we chatted. My mom got alittle tipsy. Lol!  Go in and try it. The food is great and the people r even better.

uq1Cv8IL-K9s6mKvjraBoQ.text: We have visited twice, the first time with a party of eleven, the second, just my wife and me.  Service was on point both times and the bottom line is that, just like the terminator, "we'll be back.".  Tip: restaurant seats about 32 inside only. Reservation definitely in order for large parties.  Our party of 11 had a reservation and was seated immediately on arrival at 2 reserved tables.  Had chicken alfredo fettucine with "no salt" for me and wife and several others tried the lobster and tenderloin special for $19.99.  I really don't know how they manage that price point, but I will take advantage as long as it is offered!    My dish was huge and prepared exactly as requested.  Pasta was perfect al dente for every pasta dish, which seldom happens.  Wife's lobster and tenderloin were cooked to perfection.  We tried a slice of the hawiian pizza another in our party ordered.  I would have chosen another, but the pizza was cooked to perfection, with toppings to the edge and the crust brown and crispy... just like I make it myself.  One in our party called the marinara a bit sweet for him.  I tasted it and I disagree.  Full tomato taste and great savory marinara taste.  On our second visit, I had the lobster and shrimp and sausage in white sauce over linguine.  Excellent is all I can say.  On our second visit, the man at the next table raved about his lasagna, which is on my radar for visit number 3.  He pointed out it was bubbling when it was served, which I love, having received so many lukewarm examples of this particular dish.  I will not bore you with other individual dish reviews.  Suffice it to say that none disappointed.  Finally, you need to try the red wine.  It is suprisingly good table wine--  not too sweet, and not too dry-- and Davo will entice you with a sample pour if you attempt to resist his friendly sales pitch.  Pro tip.  Davo pours generously.  You get 4 glasses per bottle.  Such a deal.  When we were finishing, Davo surprised us with complimentary NY style cheesecake.  So very good.   In case you haven't figured it from other reviews, the owner, Davo is the star of this show and he is entertaining, without fail.  He is originally from the Bronx and has operated 10 "joints" as he calls them.  I will not step on any of his many jokes and one liners.  Thera are a couple I have appropriated from him.  Davo, I haven't forgotten the cheer wood smoked salmon I promised you on our second visit.  It will hit the door in the next few days, OK?  Lastly, there is an authentic Italian piano player on the weekend. He was pretty good, but he speaks mostly Italian, so brush up!

zMuCz--a8TVvvPSrhCeNRg.text: The food was absolutely excellent- but believe it or not, that's not the best part of the experience. We came in from L.A. and drove across town from where we were staying because we had heard good things. There's tons of places you can get pizza in Vegas, but from now on, in my mind- there is only ONE. PAPA PINNY'S!!!  We were immediately welcomed by Kiana and Tom who were both incredibly friendly. The restaurant is charming and inviting. It's exactly what a traditional pizzeria should be. We hit them up on a Monday night not during peak hours, so they weren't busy- but that may have been the best timing ever.   We ordered garlic knots and a supreme pizza. After we ordered, Kiana came out to offer us some complimentary wine. Shortly after that, Papa Pinny himself came out to introduce himself to us and talk with us about our experience. He also offered us some complimentary wine. Did I mention that he brought us out some complimentary garlic bread? Delicious garlic bread. Some of the best garlic bread I've ever had.   Really cool to watch a hand-tossed pizza being made like a True artist like Tom! And the pizza was delicious. Perfect mix of sauce and toppings. Loved it.   Like I said- the food is outstanding, but not even the best part of the experience. The best part is the people. Everyone was so incredibly kind and friendly. Tom and Papa Pinny kept coming over to visit. And there was a nice gentleman there named Scott. We talked a lot. We talked about hockey. We talked about Los Angeles and Vegas and Hughes Aircraft and you can tell- these people care about their customers. And it wasn't phony. These people are just genuinely cool, kind people. How often do you walk out of a pizza place feeling loved and respected? How often do you walk out of a pizza place feeling like you've made new friends? Feeling like family.  Papa Pinny has a guest book for everyone to sign. We were glad to sign it. And at one point, Papa came to take a picture with the family. We were told they were collecting photos of happy customers to put up on the wall at some point.   Long story short: I can't say enough good things about this place. And we love the people. We will be back. I can't wait to come back.  And maybe next time we'll take the challenge of the massive square cut pizza they offer!  God Bless Papa Pinny, Tom, Kiana and Scott and everyone there! TRY THIS PLACE!

GRO012rRW_yqLuivzoOPGg.text: I just had the most pleasant surprise eating here at Giovanni Hole In the Wall!!  This place is a hidden gem, so put this on your list of must try place to eat .  The outside doesn't do it justice.  You open the door and you are so surprised with the quaint ambience, along with the great service from a mist enjoyable staff.  Then there is the food, which was delicious!!i had the lasagne. Which came with salad and bread , it was so fresh and the taste was phenomenal !! Love love love it and I will be back.  It's so nice to find a hole in the wall with all good qualities!! Food, service etc.

lYU3sYyzYuKSJGC5feW4Qw.text: Definitely a hole in the wall. Tiny place but the live music is a super talented Father and son guitar and violinist duo. They are amazing musicians that you can't help but move to their music. Just loud enough you could have a comfortable conversation but not feel like you're a part of everyone's conversations. What a great find! Thin crust pizza that stayed crisp and the flavors complemented each other. It was so delicious! We waited a bit for our pizza but that's to be expected with freshly made food but again the live music made the wait feel more like a show. To finish it off we ordered the strawberry cheesecake made from scratch by Giovanni. Delicious!!!! The service was so friendly and attentive! This is an experience and a must try!

k4kiM5md6rura13od3Afog.text: Go in to eat grub hub will take twice as long as it says. Been 1.5hrs and still haven't seen the food. Food is great but this is crazy

WL9fqvuJOSqKg3HR99KuDw.text: Craving pizza and not able to leave my house, I called in an order for delivery one weekday afternoon. The lady who answered the phone and took my order was very sweet. I ordered a house salad with house Italian dressing, and a pepperoni and mushroom calzone. Total with tax and tip was $27. A bit pricey for a meal for one in my opinion. She quoted me 45 mins for delivery and the delivery time was spot on, if not few mins early.   The calzone was pretty good. It was stuffed with delicious ricotta and mozzarella cheese, and I got pepperoni and Mushrooms as toppings. The zone came with a side of marinara sauce which was tasty. The house salad had spring mix, black olives, garbanzo and kidney beans and mozzarella cheese. The Italian dressing was very good, definitely house made. This wasn't anything that I need to have again ASAP, but I'd be inclined to order the salad again for that yummy Italian dressing.

Victor, our waiter (who could have a future as a comedian and exuded the best happy attitude) greeted us and got us settled in no time with the delicious house wine served in very generous glasses. iYIiCRqtIcz0hzQ6ghnCxg.text: We wanted good authentic Italian food, however we didn't want to venture onto the strip. Our first go-to was Yelp, then Google Maps and after a few wrong turns we finally found ourselves here.  I prefer to call it "Giovanni's Gem In the Wall". As soon as we opened the door and heard Sandor's lovely violin, everything just went up from there.  Seth our great server, Giovanni the owner....oh and the food!  Did I mention the food?  It's superb!

f_9cn-AgekiKs4Daou_36g.text: What a find!!!!! Saw there were new owners so decided to give it another go and so glad we did! What drew me to this place was the $19.99 Filet and Lobster special but what we ended up having was just as divine!  Davo the owner took the time to come over, introduce himself and chat with us with his HUGE glass of Dego-Red in hand. We found out through conversation the lovely lady who greeted us was his wife who was also very welcoming. Ordered the Antipasto, Caprese, Spaghetti and Meatballs (BIG), Cheese Ravioli, homemade cheesecake and homemade tiramisu accompanied by a delicious House Red blend. Total bill: $80 The antipasto was huge with a great selection of quality meats and cheeses, the caprese made with heirloom tomatoes topped with a creamy buffalo mozzarella and a nice balsamic glaze. The spaghetti and meatballs-my Dad could eat this dish morning, noon and night and every time we've gone out for Italian-the dish always falls short even at some of the 5 star restaurants here in Vegas. BUT NOT THIS TIME!!! He's eyes actually LIT up when he tasted the sauce! "THIS" he said "IS HOW YOU MAKE SPAGHETTI!" I too loved the sauce-great consistency, slightly sweet and all essence of the tomato-not your typical overly seasoned too thick wall paper paste or the ragu type sauce...perfect balance! The meatballs-homemade, huge and free of fillings other than what should be in a meatball. The raviolis were filled with a very creamy cheese that melted in your mouth. The portions...definitely enough to split and satisfy 2 people. Even though we were filled to the brim; we couldn't pass up the cheesecake and tiramisu which were D-Lish!!! Also, there's a nice keyboardist who plays at a perfect level of sound who complements the quaint decor and welcoming atmosphere. Great things come in small packages and this one delivered!!!!  Can't recommend here enough; whether for a date, family dinner or a few friends coming together for good conversation and food-this will become your new spot! It's become ours!

ftQTlfFbEAigABUDsKF68A.text: Best lasagna I've ever had! I had nothing but an amazing experience here.
